entries.heading: Introduction
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-15 Thu 14:06] Image overlays provide inline image display functionality in org-mode files, similar to Emacs org-mode's image display feature. When enabled, image links are rendered as thumbnails directly in the editor, allowing you to preview images without opening them separately. This feature enhances the visual experience of working with org documents that contain images, such as: - Scientific notebooks with plots and diagrams - Documentation with screenshots and illustration

entries.heading: How Image Overlays Work
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-15 Thu 14:07] Due to VS Code's limitations compared to Emacs overlays, the extension uses *Hover Previews* - Full-size image preview when hovering over image links Thumbnails are automatically generated and cached for performance, using ImageMagick or native macOS tools when available.

entries.heading: Supported Image Formats
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-15 Thu 14:07] The image overlay system supports the following image formats: | Format | Extension(s)      | Notes                           | |--------+-------------------+---------------------------------| | PNG    | .png              | Fully supported                 | | JPEG   | .jpg, .jpeg       | Fully supported                 | | GIF    | .gif              | Fully supported (static frames) | | SVG    | .svg              | Scalable vector graphics        | | WebP   | .webp

entries.heading: Basic Image Links
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-15 Thu 14:07] The simplest way to include an image is with a basic link: #+BEGIN_SRC org [[./_static/logo.svg]] #+END_SRC This displays the image inline and can be clicked to open.

entries.heading: File Protocol Links
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-15 Thu 14:08] You can explicitly use the file: protocol: #+BEGIN_SRC org [[file:./_static/logo.svg]] #+END_SRC Both formats work identically - the file: prefix is optional for local files.

entries.heading: Links with Descriptions
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 09:33] Add descriptive text that appears as a clickable link: #+BEGIN_SRC org [[./_static/logo.svg][My beautiful diagram]] [[file:./_static/logo.svg][Demo Screenshot]] #+END_SRC The description text is shown in the editor, while the image overlay appears in the gutter or inline.

entries.heading: Absolute vs Relative Paths
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 09:49] Both absolute and relative paths are supported: #+BEGIN_SRC org # Relative to current file [[./_static/logo.svg]] # Absolute paths [[file:/Users/jkitchin/Dropbox/projects/scimax_vscode/docs/_static/logo.svg]] [[file:~/Dropbox/projects/scimax_vscode/docs/_static/logo.svg]] #+END_SRC The ~ (tilde) is expanded to the home directory on Unix-like systems.

entries.heading: Remote Images
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 09:52] Remote image URLs are *not* displayed as overlays but are still valid links: [[https://www.google.com/images/branding/googlelogo/1x/googlelogo_color_272x92dp.png]] These links work for navigation but won't show thumbnails in the editor.

entries.heading: ATTR_ORG Keyword
entries.content: Control how images are displayed using the #+ATTR_ORG: keyword above the image link: #+BEGIN_SRC org #+ATTR_ORG: :width 400 [[_static/logo.svg]] #+END_SRC *Note:* Currently, the #+ATTR_ORG: keyword is parsed but the :width and :height attributes primarily affect *export* output rather than the overlay display size. The overlay thumbnail size is controlled by the [[*Configuration Settings][configuration settings]].

entries.heading: Supported Attributes
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 09:40] | Attribute | Purpose                      | Example              | |-----------+------------------------------+----------------------| | :width    | Image width (export)         | :width 400           | | :height   | Image height (export)        | :height 300          | | :scale    | Scale factor (export)        | :scale 0.5           | | :align    | Alignment (export)           | :align center        | | :alt      | Alt text (export)            | :alt "Descriptio

entries.heading: Export-Specific Attributes
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 09:40] For LaTeX and HTML export, use backend-specific attributes: #+ATTR_LATEX: :width 0.8\textwidth :placement [htbp] #+ATTR_HTML: :width 600px :class figure [[file:./_static/logo.svg]] See [[file:10-export.org][Export Documentation]] for more details on export attributes.

entries.heading: Adding Captions
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 19:52] Add captions that appear in exports: #+NAME: fig:logo #+CAPTION: System Architecture Diagram [[file:./_static/logo.svg]]

entries.heading: Global Toggle
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 09:54] Toggle image overlays for all org files: - *Command:* Scimax: Toggle Image Overlays - *Command ID:* [[cmd:scimax.imageOverlays.toggle]]

entries.heading: Per-File Toggle
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 09:54] Toggle image overlays for the current file only: - *Command:* Scimax: Toggle Image Overlays for Current File - *Command ID:* scimax.imageOverlays.toggleCurrentFile This is useful when you want overlays disabled for one specific large document but enabled globally.

entries.heading: Via Configuration
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 09:54] Permanently enable or disable in your settings.json: #+BEGIN_SRC json { "scimax.imageOverlays.enabled": true } #+END_SRC Set to false to disable by default.

entries.heading: scimax.imageOverlays.enabled
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 09:31] *Type:* boolean *Default:* true Enable or disable inline image thumbnails globally. #+BEGIN_SRC json { "scimax.imageOverlays.enabled": true } #+END_SRC

entries.heading: scimax.imageOverlays.maxWidth
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 09:31] *Type:* number *Default:* 96 Maximum width in pixels for thumbnail icons. Thumbnails are scaled down to fit within these dimensions while maintaining aspect ratio. #+BEGIN_SRC json { "scimax.imageOverlays.maxWidth": 128 } #+END_SRC

entries.heading: scimax.imageOverlays.maxHeight
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 09:31] *Type:* number *Default:* 96 Maximum height in pixels for thumbnail icons. #+BEGIN_SRC json { "scimax.imageOverlays.maxHeight": 128 } #+END_SRC

entries.heading: scimax.imageOverlays.renderMode
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 09:31] *Type:* string (enum) *Default:* "gutter" *Options:* gutter, after, both Controls where image thumbnails are displayed: - gutter - Show thumbnail in the editor gutter (line margin) - *recommended* - after - Show emoji and dimensions inline after the link text - both - Show both gutter thumbnail and inline decoration #+BEGIN_SRC json { "scimax.imageOverlays.renderMode": "gutter" } #+END_SRC *Recommendations:* - Use gutter for a clean, unobtrusive experience - Use af

entries.heading: scimax.imageOverlays.onlyWhenCursorNotInLink
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 10:01] *Type:* boolean *Default:* true Hide the overlay when your cursor is inside the image link. This prevents the thumbnail from obscuring the link text you're editing. #+BEGIN_SRC json { "scimax.imageOverlays.onlyWhenCursorNotInLink": true } #+END_SRC Set to false to always show overlays, even when editing.

entries.heading: scimax.imageOverlays.excludePatterns
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 10:01] *Type:* array of strings *Default:* [ ] Regex patterns for image paths to exclude from overlay display. Useful for hiding certain directories or file patterns. #+BEGIN_SRC json { "scimax.imageOverlays.excludePatterns": [ "\\.tmp/", "/archive/", "draft-.*\\.png" ] } #+END_SRC Examples: - "\\.tmp/" - Exclude images in .tmp directories - "^http" - Exclude remote URLs (already excluded by default) - "screenshot-.*" - Exclude files starting with "screenshot-"

entries.heading: scimax.imageOverlays.maxOverlaysPerDocument
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 10:02] *Type:* number *Default:* 200 Maximum number of image overlays to display per document. This prevents performance issues in documents with hundreds of images. #+BEGIN_SRC json { "scimax.imageOverlays.maxOverlaysPerDocument": 500 } #+END_SRC If your document exceeds this limit, you'll see a warning message.

entries.heading: scimax.imageOverlays.showDimensions
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 10:02] *Type:* boolean *Default:* true When using after or both render modes, show image dimensions (e.g., "800x600") in the inline decoration. #+BEGIN_SRC json { "scimax.imageOverlays.showDimensions": true } #+END_SRC

entries.heading: scimax.imageOverlays.cacheEnabled
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 10:02] *Type:* boolean *Default:* true Enable thumbnail caching for faster loading. Thumbnails are stored in the extension's global storage directory. #+BEGIN_SRC json { "scimax.imageOverlays.cacheEnabled": true } #+END_SRC Set to false to disable caching (may impact performance).

entries.heading: Jupyter Kernel Output
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 10:05] Jupyter kernels automatically save image output to the .ob-jupyter/ directory: #+BEGIN_SRC jupyter-python :session py import matplotlib.pyplot as plt import numpy as np plt.plot([1, 2, 3, 4], [1, 4, 9, 16]) plt.show() #+END_SRC #+RESULTS: [[file:.ob-jupyter/output-1768662289804-0.png]] These images are automatically displayed as overlays when image overlays are enabled. See [[file:09-jupyter.org][Jupyter Documentation]] for more details on Jupyter integration.

entries.heading: Scimax: Toggle Image Overlays
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 12:42] *Command ID:* [[cmd:scimax.imageOverlays.toggle]] Toggle image overlays globally for all org files. When disabled, no thumbnails are shown but links remain functional.

entries.heading: Scimax: Toggle Image Overlays for Current File
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 12:42] *Command ID:* [[cmd:scimax.imageOverlays.toggleCurrentFile]] Toggle image overlays for the currently active org file only. Useful for temporarily hiding overlays in specific documents.

entries.heading: Scimax: Refresh Image Overlays
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 09:51] *Command ID:* [[cmd:scimax.imageOverlays.refresh]] Manually refresh all image overlays in visible editors. This can be useful if: - You've modified image files externally - Overlays aren't updating correctly - You've changed configuration settings

entries.heading: Scimax: Clear Image Overlay Cache
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 09:51] *Command ID:* [[cmd:scimax.imageOverlays.clearCache]] Clear the thumbnail cache. This will: - Delete all cached thumbnails - Free up disk space - Force thumbnails to be regenerated on next display Useful if thumbnails are corrupted or you want to reclaim space.

entries.heading: Scimax: Show Image Overlay Cache Statistics
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 09:50] *Command ID:* [[cmd:scimax.imageOverlays.showStats]] Display information about the thumbnail cache: - Number of cached thumbnails - Total cache size in KB Useful for monitoring cache usage.

entries.heading: Images Not Showing
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 09:51] If image overlays aren't displaying: 1. *Check if overlays are enabled:* - Run command: Scimax: Toggle Image Overlays - Check setting: scimax.imageOverlays.enabled 2. *Verify the image file exists:* - Hover over the link to see the full path - Check for "Image not found" warning in the hover tooltip - Verify file permissions 3. *Check the file extension:* - Ensure the file has a supported image extension - Extensions are case-insensitive (.PNG works like .png)

entries.heading: Overlays Disappear When Editing
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 09:51] This is *normal behavior* when scimax.imageOverlays.onlyWhenCursorNotInLink is true (default). The overlay hides when your cursor is inside the link to prevent obscuring the text you're editing. To always show overlays: #+BEGIN_SRC json { "scimax.imageOverlays.onlyWhenCursorNotInLink": false } #+END_SRC

entries.heading: Performance Issues
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 09:51] If you experience slow performance: 1. *Reduce the overlay limit:* #+BEGIN_SRC json { "scimax.imageOverlays.maxOverlaysPerDocument": 100 } #+END_SRC 2. *Reduce thumbnail size:* #+BEGIN_SRC json { "scimax.imageOverlays.maxWidth": 64, "scimax.imageOverlays.maxHeight": 64 } #+END_SRC 3. *Use gutter mode only:* #+BEGIN_SRC json { "scimax.imageOverlays.renderMode": "gutter" } #+END_SRC 4. *Disable overlays for specific files:* - Use command: Scimax: Toggle Image Overlay

entries.heading: Thumbnails Are Blurry or Corrupted
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 09:51] 1. *Clear the cache:* - Run command: Scimax: Clear Image Overlay Cache 2. *Check if ImageMagick is installed:* - The extension uses ImageMagick (convert) or macOS sips for thumbnail generation - Install ImageMagick: brew install imagemagick (macOS) or apt install imagemagick (Linux) 3. *Verify the original image isn't corrupted:* - Open the image in an external viewer

entries.heading: Relative Paths Not Resolving
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 12:43] If relative paths aren't working: 1. *Use ./ prefix for clarity:* [[./_static/plot.png]]  # Better [[_static/plot.png]]    # Also works, but less clear 2. *Check your working directory:* - Paths are resolved relative to the org file's directory 3. *Use absolute paths as a workaround:* [[file:/Users/jkitchin/Dropbox/projects/scimax_vscode/docs/_static/plot.png]]

entries.heading: Hover Preview Not Working
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 12:43] If hover previews aren't showing: 1. *Check hover delay:* - VS Code has a built-in hover delay setting - Try hovering for longer 2. *Verify hover provider is active:* - Hover should work for all org links, not just images - If no hovers work at all, check VS Code's language server settings 3. *Try a different image format:* - Some formats may not preview well - SVG and PNG typically work best

entries.heading: Minimal Configuration
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 12:44] For basic image overlay functionality: #+BEGIN_SRC json { "scimax.imageOverlays.enabled": true, "scimax.imageOverlays.renderMode": "gutter" } #+END_SRC

entries.heading: Power User Configuration
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 12:44] For maximum visual feedback: #+BEGIN_SRC json { "scimax.imageOverlays.enabled": true, "scimax.imageOverlays.maxWidth": 128, "scimax.imageOverlays.maxHeight": 128, "scimax.imageOverlays.renderMode": "both", "scimax.imageOverlays.onlyWhenCursorNotInLink": true, "scimax.imageOverlays.showDimensions": true, "scimax.imageOverlays.maxOverlaysPerDocument": 500, "scimax.imageOverlays.cacheEnabled": true } #+END_SRC

entries.heading: Performance-Focused Configuration
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 12:44] For large documents with many images: #+BEGIN_SRC json { "scimax.imageOverlays.enabled": true, "scimax.imageOverlays.maxWidth": 64, "scimax.imageOverlays.maxHeight": 64, "scimax.imageOverlays.renderMode": "gutter", "scimax.imageOverlays.onlyWhenCursorNotInLink": true, "scimax.imageOverlays.showDimensions": false, "scimax.imageOverlays.maxOverlaysPerDocument": 100, "scimax.imageOverlays.cacheEnabled": true, "scimax.imageOverlays.excludePatterns": ["archive/", "\\.tm

entries.heading: Complete Example
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 12:44] Here's a complete example showing various image link formats: #+BEGIN_SRC org ,* My Research Notes ,** Experimental Results The experiment produced the following results: ,#+CAPTION: Sine wave plot ,#+NAME: fig:sine ,#+ATTR_ORG: :width 400 [[file:./plots/sine-wave.png]] As shown in Figure [[fig:sine]], the sine wave exhibits periodic behavior. ,** Data Visualization ,#+BEGIN_SRC jupyter-python :session analysis import matplotlib.pyplot as plt import numpy as np x =

entries.heading: Inserting Screenshots
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-24 Sat 17:37] The extension provides a cross-platform screenshot command that captures a screen region and inserts a link to the saved image.

entries.heading: Taking a Screenshot
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-24 Sat 17:37] Press =F10= in an org or markdown file to take a screenshot: 1. Press =F10= - the screen capture tool activates 2. Select the area you want to capture (or press Escape to cancel) 3. The screenshot is saved to a =screenshots/= directory next to your file 4. An image link is automatically inserted at the cursor position | Platform | Tool Used                                                 | |----------+-----------------------------------------------------------| | m

entries.heading: macOS Permission Setup
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-24 Sat 17:37] The first time you use the screenshot command on macOS, you may need to grant screen recording permission to VS Code: 1. Press =F10= to trigger the screenshot 2. macOS will show a permission dialog or the capture will fail silently 3. Go to *System Settings > Privacy & Security > Screen Recording* 4. Enable the checkbox for *Visual Studio Code* 5. *Restart VS Code* for the permission to take effect 6. Try =F10= again

entries.heading: Inserted Link Format
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-24 Sat 17:37] For org-mode files, the inserted link includes a width attribute: #+BEGIN_SRC org #+attr_org: :width 800 [[./screenshots/screenshot-2026-01-23-14-30-45.png]] #+END_SRC For markdown files: #+BEGIN_SRC markdown ![screenshot](./screenshots/screenshot-2026-01-23-14-30-45.png) #+END_SRC The width is automatically determined from the image dimensions (capped at 800 pixels).

entries.heading: Screenshot Directory
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-24 Sat 17:37] Screenshots are saved to a =screenshots/= subdirectory relative to the current file. The directory is created automatically if it doesn't exist. Filenames follow the pattern: =screenshot-YYYY-MM-DD-HH-MM-SS.png=

entries.heading: Linux Screenshot Tools
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-24 Sat 17:37] On Linux, the extension tries these tools in order and uses the first one found: 1. =gnome-screenshot -a= (GNOME desktop) 2. =scrot -s= (lightweight, widely available) 3. =flameshot gui= (feature-rich, popular choice) 4. =maim -s= (modern alternative to scrot) 5. =import= (ImageMagick, works everywhere) Install at least one of these tools for screenshot functionality.

entries.heading: Command Reference
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-24 Sat 17:37] | Command                 | Keybinding | Description                           | |-------------------------+------------+---------------------------------------| | scimax.insertScreenshot | F10        | Capture screen region and insert link |

entries.heading: See Also
entries.content: - [[file:05-links.org][Links]] - General link syntax and functionality - [[file:07-source-blocks.org][Source Blocks]] - Executing code that generates images - [[file:09-jupyter.org][Jupyter Integration]] - Working with Jupyter kernels - [[file:10-export.org][Export]] - Exporting documents with images - [[file:26-configuration.org][Configuration]] - Full configuration reference

entries.heading: Thumbnail Generation
entries.content: Thumbnails are generated using: 1. *ImageMagick* (convert command) - Preferred, works on all platforms 2. *macOS sips* - Native macOS tool, used as fallback on Mac 3. *Direct copy* - If no tools available, original images are used Thumbnails are cached in the extension's global storage directory with filenames based on: - MD5 hash of the original image path - Configured thumbnail dimensions - Original file extension

entries.heading: Cache Location
entries.content: Thumbnails are stored in: - *Linux:* ~/.config/Code/User/globalStorage/scimax-vscode/image-overlay-cache/ - *macOS:* ~/Library/Application Support/Code/User/globalStorage/scimax-vscode/image-overlay-cache/ - *Windows:* %APPDATA%\Code\User\globalStorage\scimax-vscode\image-overlay-cache\

entries.heading: Performance Considerations
entries.content: - Thumbnail generation is asynchronous and doesn't block the editor - The cache prevents regenerating thumbnails on each file open - The maxOverlaysPerDocument setting prevents memory issues with large documents - Overlays are debounced during typing to avoid excessive updates - Gutter mode is more performant than after/both modes

entries.heading: VS Code Limitations
entries.content: Unlike Emacs, VS Code cannot: - Display arbitrary-sized inline images in the editor - Replace link text with actual image content - Provide true "overlay" functionality at the text level The implementation uses VS Code's decoration API with gutter icons as the closest approximation to Emacs overlays.

entries.heading: Introduction
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-15 Thu 13:34] The Agenda system in Scimax VS Code provides powerful views of your scheduled tasks, deadlines, and TODO items. It helps you stay organized by showing what needs to be done and when. Think of the Agenda as your command center for task management - it collects tasks from all your org files and presents them in meaningful ways: - *Day/Week views* - See what's scheduled for specific time periods - *TODO lists* - Review all incomplete tasks - *Deadline views* - Track u

entries.heading: What is the Agenda?
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-15 Thu 13:34] The Agenda is a dynamic view that displays TODO items, scheduled tasks, and deadlines from your org files. Unlike browsing individual files, the Agenda aggregates information across all your documents.

entries.heading: Agenda Items
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-15 Thu 13:34] An agenda item is any headline with: - A TODO keyword (TODO, DONE, NEXT, WAITING, etc.) - A SCHEDULED timestamp - A DEADLINE timestamp - An active timestamp

entries.heading: Scheduled Items
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-15 Thu 13:34] Tasks with SCHEDULED timestamps appear in the agenda on their scheduled date: #+BEGIN_SRC org

entries.heading: TODO Write report
entries.content: SCHEDULED: <2026-01-15 Wed> #+END_SRC This appears in the agenda starting January 15.

entries.heading: Deadlines
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-15 Thu 13:35] Tasks with DEADLINE timestamps appear with warning indicators: #+BEGIN_SRC org

entries.heading: TODO Submit proposal
entries.content: DEADLINE: <2026-01-20 Mon> #+END_SRC Shows in the agenda with countdown (e.g., "in 7 days") and becomes overdue if not completed.

entries.heading: Overdue Items
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-15 Thu 13:35] Items past their deadline appear prominently with warning indicators and show how many days overdue they are.

entries.heading: Unscheduled TODOs
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-15 Thu 13:35] TODO items without dates can be included in agenda views to ensure nothing is forgotten.

entries.heading: Two Agenda Systems
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-15 Thu 13:35] Scimax VS Code provides two complementary agenda implementations:

entries.heading: Native/File-Based Agenda
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-15 Thu 13:35] - Scans org files on-demand - Works immediately without indexing - Provides tree view in sidebar - Commands: scimax.agenda.* - Best for: Quick views, smaller document sets

entries.heading: Database-Backed Agenda
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-15 Thu 13:35] - Uses indexed data for fast queries - Requires indexing files first - Integrates with search and filtering - Commands: scimax.db.agenda, scimax.db.deadlines - Best for: Large document collections, complex queries Both systems can be used together - choose based on your needs.

entries.heading: Agenda View Modes
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-15 Thu 13:35] The agenda can display information in different time-based views.

entries.heading: Day Agenda
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-15 Thu 13:51] Shows items for a single day. | Command           | Key Binding | Description    | |-------------------+-------------+----------------| | scimax.agenda.day | C-c aa      | Today's agenda | The day view displays: - Scheduled items for the day - Deadlines due today - Overdue items - Time-of-day for timed entries #+BEGIN_EXAMPLE Today (Wednesday, Jan 15, 2026)  09:00  TODO [#A] Team standup                    :work: 14:00  TODO Client pre

entries.heading: Week Agenda
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-16 Fri 21:04] Shows a 7-day view starting from today. | Command            |        | Description | |--------------------+--------+-------------| | scimax.agenda.week | C-c aw | Next 7 days | Groups items by date, making it easy to plan your week: #+BEGIN_EXAMPLE Week Agenda (Jan 15-21, 2026)  Wednesday, Jan 15 09:00  TODO Team standup 14:00  TODO Client meeting Thursday, Jan 16 TODO Code review DEADLINE: Deploy feature    (in 1 day) Friday, Jan 17 T

entries.heading: Fortnight Agenda
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-16 Fri 21:04] Shows the next 14 days. | Command                 | Description  | |-------------------------+--------------| | scimax.agenda.fortnight | Next 14 days | Useful for medium-term planning and catching upcoming deadlines.

entries.heading: Month Agenda
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-16 Fri 21:04] Shows the next 30 days. | Command             | Key Binding | Description  | |---------------------+-------------+--------------| | scimax.agenda.month | C-c am      | Next 30 days | Good for long-term planning and ensuring nothing falls through the cracks.

entries.heading: Custom Time Ranges
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-16 Fri 21:04] The database-backed agenda supports custom time ranges: #+BEGIN_EXAMPLE ; Next 2 weeks Command: scimax.db.agenda  "Next 2 weeks" ; Next month Command: scimax.db.agenda  "Next month" ; Next 3 months Command: scimax.db.agenda  "Next 3 months" ; All items (no time limit) Command: scimax.db.agenda  "All items" #+END_EXAMPLE

entries.heading: TODO List View
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-16 Fri 21:04] The TODO list shows all incomplete tasks regardless of date. | Command                | Key Binding | Description               | |------------------------+-------------+---------------------------| | scimax.agenda.todoList | C-c at      | All TODO items (native)   | | scimax.db.showTodos    |             | All TODO items (database) |

entries.heading: Grouping by State
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-16 Fri 21:05] TODOs are grouped by their keyword state: #+BEGIN_EXAMPLE TODO List (45 items)  TODO (32 items) [#A] Fix critical bug                           :urgent: Write documentation                             :docs: Review code changes                             :review: NEXT (8 items) [#A] Implement login feature                    :feature: Deploy to staging                               :deploy: WAITING (5 items) Approval from manager

entries.heading: Filtering TODO List
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-16 Fri 21:05] Filter by state when viewing TODOs: #+BEGIN_SRC text Command: scimax.db.showTodos  Select filter: "All TODOs", "TODO", "NEXT", "WAITING", etc. #+END_SRC Shows only items in the selected state.

entries.heading: Deadline Views
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-16 Fri 21:05] Focus specifically on items with deadlines.

entries.heading: Upcoming Deadlines
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-18 Sun 12:50] | Command                         | Key Bindings | Description             | |---------------------------------+--------------+-------------------------| | [[cmd:scimax.agenda.deadlines]] | C-c ad       | Show upcoming deadlines | | [[cmd:scimax.db.deadlines]]     |              | Database deadline view  | Displays deadlines with time-until indicators: #+BEGIN_EXAMPLE Upcoming Deadlines (8 items)    TODO Submit proposal

entries.heading: Deadline Display

entries.heading: Grouping and Sorting
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-18 Sun 10:13] Agenda views can be grouped and sorted in different ways.

entries.heading: By Date (Default)
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-18 Sun 12:51] Groups items by their date: #+BEGIN_EXAMPLE Today Item 1 Item 2 Tomorrow Item 3 Item 4 #+END_EXAMPLE

entries.heading: By Category
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-18 Sun 12:51] Groups items by their CATEGORY property or file: #+BEGIN_EXAMPLE Work Project A tasks Project B tasks Personal Home tasks Errands #+END_EXAMPLE

entries.heading: By Priority
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-18 Sun 12:51] Groups items by priority level: #+BEGIN_EXAMPLE Priority A [#A] Critical bug [#A] Important meeting Priority B [#B] Code review [#B] Documentation No Priority Regular tasks #+END_EXAMPLE

entries.heading: By TODO State
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 13:17] Groups items by their keyword: #+BEGIN_EXAMPLE TODO Task 1 Task 2 NEXT Task 3 WAITING Task 4 #+END_EXAMPLE

entries.heading: Changing Grouping
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-18 Sun 12:51] | Command                               | Description       | |---------------------------------------+-------------------| | [[cmd:scimax.agenda.groupByDate]]     | Group by date     | | [[cmd:scimax.agenda.groupByCategory]] | Group by category | | [[cmd:scimax.agenda.groupByPriority]] | Group by priority | Tree view groups update immediately.

entries.heading: Sort Options
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-18 Sun 12:51] Items within groups are sorted by: 1. *Time* - Default, chronological order 2. *Priority* - High to low (A  B  C) 3. *Category* - Alphabetical by category 4. *TODO state* - By keyword 5. *Tag* - By first tag alphabetically

entries.heading: Filtering
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 13:20] Focus the agenda on specific criteria.

entries.heading: Filter by Tag
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-18 Sun 12:51] Show only items with a specific tag. | Command                           | Description              | |-----------------------------------+--------------------------| | [[cmd:scimax.agenda.filterByTag]] | Filter by tag (native)   | | [[cmd:scimax.db.searchByTag]]     | Filter by tag (database) | Workflow: 1. Run command 2. Select a tag from the list 3. See only items with that tag #+BEGIN_EXAMPLE Command: scimax.agenda.filterByTag  Select tag: "urgent" Items with

entries.heading: Filter by Priority
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 13:21] Database filtering supports priority: #+BEGIN_SRC text Query: priority:A Shows: Only [#A] priority items #+END_SRC

entries.heading: Filter by TODO State
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 13:21] Show only specific TODO states: #+BEGIN_SRC text Command: [[cmd:scimax.db.showTodos]]  Select: "NEXT" Shows: Only NEXT items #+END_SRC

entries.heading: Filter by Date Range
entries.content: Combine time ranges with other filters: #+BEGIN_SRC text Command: [[cmd:scimax.db.agenda]]  Select: "Next 2 weeks" Shows: Items in next 14 days only #+END_SRC

entries.heading: Combining Filters
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 13:22] Database queries support multiple filters: #+BEGIN_SRC text Show TODOs: - With tag :work: - Priority A or B - Due in next week #+END_SRC Use the database search commands for complex filtering.

entries.heading: Tree View Interface
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-18 Sun 12:52] The Agenda tree view appears in the VS Code sidebar: #+BEGIN_EXAMPLE AGENDA  Today (3 items)   TODO Team standup   TODO [#A] Submit report   TODO Review code  Tomorrow (2 items)   TODO Planning meeting   TODO Update documentation #+END_EXAMPLE

entries.heading: Opening Items
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-18 Sun 12:53] Click any item in the tree view or quick pick to: - Open the file containing the item - Jump to the exact line - Highlight the headline The item is centered in the editor for easy viewing.

entries.heading: Quick Pick Navigation
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-18 Sun 12:53] Commands show items in a searchable quick pick: #+BEGIN_EXAMPLE Agenda: 12 items                           [Type to search]   TODO Team standup      TODO [#A] 09:00    work.org:42  TODO Submit report     DEADLINE (TODAY)   project.org:156  TODO Review code       TODO :review:       dev.org:78  TODO Update docs       TODO               readme.org:12 #+END_EXAMPLE Features: - Type to filter items - Shows

entries.heading: Item Icons

entries.heading: Keyboard Navigation
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 13:26] In tree view: - Arrow keys: Navigate items - Enter: Open item - Space: Expand/collapse group In quick pick: - Type: Filter items - Arrow keys: Navigate - Enter: Open item - Escape: Cancel

entries.heading: Agenda Configuration

entries.heading: Exclude Patterns

entries.heading: Default Time Span
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 13:25] Set the default number of days for agenda views: | Setting                   | Default | Description            | |---------------------------+---------+------------------------| | scimax.agenda.defaultSpan | 7       | Days to show in agenda | #+BEGIN_SRC json { "scimax.agenda.defaultSpan": 14 } #+END_SRC

entries.heading: Show Done Items
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 13:25] Include or exclude completed items: | Setting                | Default | Description               | |------------------------+---------+---------------------------| | scimax.agenda.showDone | false   | Show DONE items in agenda | #+BEGIN_SRC json { "scimax.agenda.showDone": true } #+END_SRC

entries.heading: Show Habits
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 13:26] Control display of recurring habit tasks: | Setting                  | Default | Description                | |--------------------------+---------+----------------------------| | scimax.agenda.showHabits | true    | Show habit items in agenda |

entries.heading: States
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 13:26] Define which TODO keywords to include: | Setting                          | Default               | |----------------------------------+-----------------------| | scimax.agenda.todoStates         | [TODO, NEXT, WAITING] | | scimax.agenda.doneStates         | [DONE, CANCELLED]     | #+BEGIN_SRC json { "scimax.agenda.todoStates": [ "TODO", "NEXT", "IN-PROGRESS", "WAITING", "REVIEW" ], "scimax.agenda.doneStates": [ "DONE", "CANCELLED", "REJECTED" ]

entries.heading: Database Integration
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 12:32] The database-backed agenda provides additional capabilities.

entries.heading: Database Agenda Features
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 12:32] The database agenda (scimax.db.agenda) offers: 1. *Fast queries* - Indexed data for instant results 2. *Complex filtering* - Search by property, tag, etc. 3. *Semantic search* - Find items by meaning 4. *Hybrid views* - Combine agenda with search

entries.heading: Indexing for Agenda
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 12:32] Before using database agenda, index your files: | Command                   | Description         | |---------------------------+---------------------| | [[cmd:scimax.db.reindex]] | Index all org files | The database automatically tracks changes, but manual reindex ensures everything is current.

entries.heading: Database Agenda Commands
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 12:33] | Command               | Description             | |-----------------------+-------------------------| | scimax.db.agenda      | Time-based agenda view  | | scimax.db.deadlines   | Upcoming deadlines      | | scimax.db.showTodos   | All TODO items          | | scimax.db.searchByTag | Items with specific tag |

entries.heading: Search Scope
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 12:34] Limit agenda queries to specific directories: | Command                    | Description      | |----------------------------+------------------| | [[cmd:scimax.db.setScope]] | Set search scope | Options: - *All files* - Search entire database - *Current directory* - Only files in current directory

entries.heading: Agenda Item Data
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 12:34] Database agenda items include: #+BEGIN_SRC typescript interface AgendaItem { type: 'deadline' | 'scheduled' | 'todo'; heading: HeadingRecord; date?: string; days_until?: number; overdue?: boolean; } #+END_SRC Properties: - type - Item category - heading - Full heading info (title, tags, priority, etc.) - date - Scheduled/deadline date - days_until - Days until/past date (negative = overdue) - overdue - Boolean flag for past deadlines

entries.heading: Querying Agenda
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 12:34] Programmatic access to agenda data: #+BEGIN_SRC typescript // Get agenda items const items = await db.getAgenda({ before: '+2w',           // Next 2 weeks includeUnscheduled: true // Include TODOs without dates }); // Filter deadlines const deadlines = items.filter(item => item.type === 'deadline'); // Find overdue const overdue = items.filter(item => item.overdue); #+END_SRC See [[file:18-database-search.org][Database Search]] for more on database queries.

entries.heading: Agenda Workflows
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 12:34] Practical approaches to using the agenda effectively.

entries.heading: Morning Planning
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 12:34] Start your day with the day agenda: 1. Run [[cmd:scimax.agenda.day]] 2. Review today's items 3. Mark priorities 4. Identify blockers 5. Clock in to first task

entries.heading: Weekly Review
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 12:34] Every week: 1. Run [[cmd:scimax.agenda.week]] 2. Check for overdue items 3. Reschedule as needed 4. Add new scheduled items 5. Review WAITING tasks

entries.heading: Deadline Management
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 12:35] Stay on top of deadlines: 1. Run [[cmd:scimax.agenda.deadlines]] or [[cmd:scimax.db.deadlines]] 2. Note items due soon 3. Start working on items with warnings 4. Address overdue items immediately 5. Update estimates for late items

entries.heading: Context-Based Work
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 12:35] Use tags to filter by context: #+BEGIN_SRC text ; At office Command: scimax.agenda.filterByTag  Select: "office" Work on office-only tasks ; Have phone available  Select: "phone" Make all phone calls ; At computer  Select: "computer" Handle computer-required tasks #+END_SRC

entries.heading: Project Review
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-16 Fri 21:06] Review project status: 1. Filter agenda by project tag 2. Check all project items 3. Identify NEXT action 4. Update completed items 5. Add new tasks as needed

entries.heading: Priority Triage
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-16 Fri 21:06] Focus on high-priority items: 1. Filter or group by priority 2. Work through all [#A] items 3. Move to [#B] items 4. Reschedule [#C] if needed

entries.heading: Keep Agenda Files Organized
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-16 Fri 21:06] Structure agenda files logically: #+BEGIN_SRC text ~/org/  work.org          ; Work tasks  personal.org      ; Personal tasks  projects/         ; Project-specific files     project-a.org     project-b.org  archive/          ; Archived (excluded) #+END_SRC Configure agenda to scan ~/org/ and exclude archive/.

entries.heading: Agenda Shows No Items
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-18 Sun 12:50] *Issue*: Agenda view is empty or shows fewer items than expected. *Solutions*: 1. *Check agenda files configuration*: #+BEGIN_SRC text Command: scimax.agenda.configure Ensure your org files are included #+END_SRC 2. *Verify TODO keywords*: - Check headlines have TODO, SCHEDULED, or DEADLINE - Ensure correct keyword spelling 3. *Check time range*: - Day view only shows today's items - Try week or month view for more items 4. *Reindex database* (for database agenda):

entries.heading: Items Not Updating
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-18 Sun 12:50] *Issue*: Changed items don't appear or update in agenda. *Solutions*: 1. *Refresh agenda*: #+BEGIN_SRC text Command: scimax.agenda.refresh #+END_SRC 2. *Reindex database*: #+BEGIN_SRC text Command: scimax.db.reindex #+END_SRC 3. *Check file watcher*: - Extension should auto-detect changes - Manual refresh if needed 4. *Save file*: - Ensure file is saved (C-s) - Agenda reads from disk

entries.heading: Tree View Not Showing
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-18 Sun 12:50] *Issue*: Agenda tree view not visible in sidebar. *Solutions*: 1. *Check view visibility*: - View  Open View  Scimax: Agenda 2. *Refresh view*: #+BEGIN_SRC text Command: scimax.agenda.refresh #+END_SRC 3. *Check for errors*: - View extension logs - Check for parsing errors in org files

entries.heading: Slow Performance
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-18 Sun 12:50] *Issue*: Agenda is slow to load or refresh. *Solutions*: 1. *Use database agenda*: - scimax.db.agenda is faster for large collections - Index files once, query quickly 2. *Limit agenda files*: - Don't include entire filesystem - Use specific directories 3. *Exclude large directories*: #+BEGIN_SRC json { "scimax.agenda.exclude": [ "**/node_modules/**", "**/vendor/**", "**/build/**" ] } #+END_SRC 4. *Optimize file sizes*: - Archive old DONE items

entries.heading: Date Display Issues
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-18 Sun 12:50] *Issue*: Dates show incorrectly or items appear on wrong days. *Solutions*: 1. *Check timestamp format*: #+BEGIN_SRC org ; Correct SCHEDULED: <2026-01-15 Wed> ; Incorrect SCHEDULED: <01/15/2026> #+END_SRC 2. *Verify day of week*: - Day must match date - Use S-<right> to recalculate 3. *Check repeaters*: #+BEGIN_SRC org ; Ensure repeater syntax is correct SCHEDULED: <2026-01-15 Wed +1w> #+END_SRC

entries.heading: Introduction
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-16 Fri 21:06] The Scimax Journal is a powerful date-based note-taking system that helps you maintain a daily journal, track your work, and build a personal knowledge base over time. Inspired by org-journal and bullet journaling, it provides a structured yet flexible way to capture thoughts, tasks, and logs throughout your day.

entries.heading: Key Features
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-16 Fri 21:06] - Automatic date-based organization with hierarchical directory structure - Multiple customizable templates for different journaling styles - Built-in calendar view for visualizing and navigating entries - Quick navigation between entries with keyboard shortcuts - Full-text search across all journal entries - Statistics tracking including writing streaks and word counts - Quick capture for timestamped log entries - Status bar integration showing current entry detai

entries.heading: Philosophy
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-16 Fri 21:06] The journal system is designed around the principle of friction-free capture. With a single keyboard shortcut (`Cmd-S-J'), you can open today's journal entry and start writing. The system handles all organization automatically, storing files in a sensible directory structure that mirrors the calendar.

entries.heading: Opening Your First Journal Entry
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 14:02] The quickest way to start journaling is to press `Cmd-Shift-j'. This will: 1. Create today's journal entry if it doesn't exist 2. Apply your default template 3. Open the file in the editor Your first entry might look like this: #+begin_src org #+TITLE: 2026-01-14 - Tuesday #+DATE: 2026-01-14 ,* Tasks - [ ] ,* Notes ,* Log #+end_src

entries.heading: Directory Structure
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-16 Fri 21:07] By default, journal entries are stored in ~/scimax-journal with the following structure: #+begin_example ~/scimax-journal/  2026/     01/        14/           2026-01-14.org        15/           2026-01-15.org        16/            2026-01-16.org     02/         01/             2026-02-01.org  .scimax/  templates/  custom.org  meeting.org #+end_example Each entry is stored in a path like YYYY/MM/DD/YYYY

entries.heading: Configuration
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-16 Fri 21:08] Configure the journal system through VS Code settings (File > Preferences > Settings or Cmd/C-,):

entries.heading: scimax.journal.directory
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-16 Fri 21:08] Directory where journal files are stored. If empty, defaults to ~/scimax-journal. #+begin_src json { "scimax.journal.directory": "~/Documents/journal" } #+end_src You can also use absolute paths or paths starting with ~ for your home directory.

entries.heading: scimax.journal.format
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-16 Fri 21:08] Choose between org-mode or Markdown format for journal entries. #+begin_src json { "scimax.journal.format": "org"  // or "markdown" } #+end_src Default: org

entries.heading: scimax.journal.template
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-16 Fri 21:08] The default template to use when creating new entries. #+begin_src json { "scimax.journal.template": "default" } #+end_src Available built-in templates: default, minimal, research, meeting, standup

entries.heading: scimax.journal.dateFormat
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-16 Fri 21:08] Date format for file names (currently only YYYY-MM-DD is supported). #+begin_src json { "scimax.journal.dateFormat": "YYYY-MM-DD" } #+end_src Default: YYYY-MM-DD

entries.heading: scimax.journal.autoTimestamp
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-16 Fri 21:08] Automatically add timestamps when using the quick log feature. #+begin_src json { "scimax.journal.autoTimestamp": true } #+end_src Default: true

entries.heading: scimax.journal.weekStartsOn
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-16 Fri 21:08] First day of the week for calendar and week views. #+begin_src json { "scimax.journal.weekStartsOn": "monday"  // or "sunday" } #+end_src Default: monday

entries.heading: Journal Templates
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-16 Fri 21:08] Templates define the structure of new journal entries. Scimax provides several built-in templates and supports custom templates.

entries.heading: default
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-16 Fri 21:08] A balanced template suitable for general daily journaling with tasks, notes, and a timestamped log. #+begin_src org #+TITLE: {{date}} - {{weekday}} #+DATE: {{date}} ,* Tasks - [ ] ,* Notes ,* Log #+end_src

entries.heading: minimal
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-16 Fri 21:08] A minimal template with just a notes section, ideal for free-form journaling. #+begin_src org #+TITLE: {{date}} #+DATE: {{date}} ,* Notes #+end_src

entries.heading: research
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-16 Fri 21:08] Designed for research work, with sections for goals, experiments, results, and references. #+begin_src org #+TITLE: Research Log - {{date}} #+DATE: {{date}} #+AUTHOR: {{author}} ,* Goals for Today - [ ] ,* Experiments ,* Results ,* Next Steps ,* References #+end_src

entries.heading: meeting
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-16 Fri 21:08] Structured template for meeting notes with attendees, agenda, and action items. #+begin_src org #+TITLE: Meeting Notes - {{date}} #+DATE: {{date}} ,* Attendees - ,* Agenda 1. ,* Discussion ,* Action Items - [ ] ,* Next Meeting #+end_src

entries.heading: standup
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-16 Fri 21:08] Daily standup format with yesterday, today, and blockers. #+begin_src org #+TITLE: Standup - {{date}} #+DATE: {{date}} ,* Yesterday - ,* Today - ,* Blockers - #+end_src

entries.heading: Template Variables
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-16 Fri 21:08] Templates support the following variables that are automatically substituted: | Variable      | Description                      | Example           | |---------------+----------------------------------+-------------------| | {{date}}      | ISO date (YYYY-MM-DD)            | 2026-01-14        | | {{year}}      | Four-digit year                  | 2026              | | {{month}}     | Two-digit month                  | 01                | | {{day}}       | Two-digi

entries.heading: Creating Custom Templates
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-16 Fri 21:09] Custom templates are stored in <journal-directory>/.scimax/templates/. Create a new template by: 1. Create the templates directory if it doesn't exist: #+begin_src bash mkdir -p ~/scimax-journal/.scimax/templates #+end_src 2. Create a template file with the same extension as your journal format (.org or .md): #+begin_src bash # For org-mode journals touch ~/scimax-journal/.scimax/templates/weekly-review.org #+end_src 3. Edit the template file with your desired stru

entries.heading: Markdown Templates
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 14:02] If you configure the journal format as Markdown, the built-in templates use Markdown syntax: #+begin_src markdown # {{date}} - {{weekday}} ## Tasks - [ ] ## Notes ## Log #+end_src Custom Markdown templates work the same way, but use the .md extension.

entries.heading: Today's Entry
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 14:02] Press C-S-J or run the command Scimax: Open Today's Journal. [[cmd:scimax.journal.new]] This is the fastest way to start journaling. If today's entry doesn't exist, it will be created using your default template.

entries.heading: New Entry for Any Date
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 14:03] To create an entry for a different date: 1. Run command: Scimax: New Journal Entry 2. Select a template 3. Enter a date in YYYY-MM-DD format (or leave empty for today) If an entry already exists for that date, you'll be asked if you want to open it instead. Example workflow for creating a meeting note: 1. C-S-P  Scimax: New Journal Entry 2. Select meeting template 3. Press Enter to use today's date 4. Entry is created and opened

entries.heading: Using Different Templates
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 14:03] You can create multiple entries for the same date using different templates by: 1. Running Scimax: New Journal Entry multiple times 2. Selecting different templates each time However, only one file per date is stored. To use multiple templates in one day, either: - Merge content manually - Use a comprehensive custom template - Create separate files outside the journal system

entries.heading: Keyboard Navigation
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 15:11] When viewing a journal entry: - C-Cmd-[ - Go to previous entry - C-Cmd-] - Go to next entry These shortcuts only work when the current file is a journal entry (filename matches YYYY-MM-DD.org or .md).

entries.heading: Go to Specific Date
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 14:05] Run Scimax: Go to Journal Date to see a list of all your entries: [[cmd:scimax.journal.goto]] #+begin_example > Scimax: Go to Journal Date  2026-01-14    Tue  2026-01-13    Mon  2026-01-12    Sun  2026-01-10    Fri ... #+end_example Use arrow keys or type to filter, then press Enter to open.

entries.heading: Calendar View
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 14:06] The calendar view provides a visual way to navigate entries:

entries.heading: Accessing the Calendar
entries.content: - Look for "Journal Calendar" in the Scimax sidebar (Activity Bar) - Or run: Scimax: Show Journal Calendar [[cmd:scimax.journal.calendar]]

entries.heading: Calendar Features
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-18 Sun 12:06] The calendar shows: - Current month with clickable days - Days with entries are highlighted with a blue dot - Today is marked with a border - Past days without entries are dimmed Calendar controls: - Click any day to open/create entry -   buttons - Navigate months - Today's Journal button - Jump to today - Month picker - Click month name to show month selector - Year navigation - Click year buttons to jump years

entries.heading: Quick Actions in Calendar
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-18 Sun 12:52] At the bottom of the calendar view: - This Week - Show this week's entries - Search - Search journal entries - Stats - Show journal statistics

entries.heading: Week View
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-18 Sun 12:08] To see all entries for the current week: Run Scimax: This Week's Entries [[cmd:scimax.journal.weekView]] This shows a quick-pick list with: - Each day of the current week that has an entry - Word count for each entry - Task completion statistics #+begin_example This week: 5 entries  Tue 2026-01-14    450 words    3/5 tasks completed  Mon 2026-01-13    320 words    5/5 tasks completed  Sun 2026-01-12    280 words ... #+end_example

entries.heading: Full-Text Search
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-18 Sun 12:52] Run Scimax: Search Journal to search your entries: [[cmd:scimax.journal.search]] 1. Select a date range: - All entries - This week - This month - This year 2. Enter your search term 3. Browse results showing: - Date of entry - Matching lines (up to 3 per entry) - Line numbers 4. Select a result to jump to that entry and line Example search results: #+begin_example 3 entries found for "machine learning"  2026-01-14    ...worked on machine learning model...    Line

entries.heading: Search Tips
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 14:11] - Searches are case-insensitive - Partial word matching is supported - Search scans the entire content including headings and metadata - Results are limited to preserve performance

entries.heading: Advanced Search
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 14:11] For more advanced searching, you can use the global Scimax search commands which index all journal entries: - Scimax: Search All Files - Full-text search with BM25 ranking - Scimax: Semantic Search - AI-powered semantic search - Scimax: Search Headings - Search only heading text These commands search across your entire workspace, including journal entries.

entries.heading: Quick Log Entry
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 14:18] The quick log feature lets you capture a timestamped note without opening a file: [[cmd:scimax.journal.quickLog]] 1. Run Scimax: Quick Log Entry or create a custom keybinding 2. Type your note 3. Press Enter The note is automatically appended to today's journal under the * Log section with a timestamp: #+begin_src org ,* Log - [14:30] Started work on documentation - [15:45] Meeting with team about project timeline - [16:20] Fixed bug in parser module #+end_src This

entries.heading: Insert Timestamp
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 14:18] When editing a journal entry, run Scimax: Insert Timestamp to insert a timestamp at the cursor: Org format: #+begin_example [2026-01-14 10:30] #+end_example Markdown format: #+begin_example 2026-01-14 10:30 #+end_example Useful for: - Manual time tracking - Marking when you started/finished tasks - Adding temporal context to notes

entries.heading: Viewing Statistics
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 14:18] Run Scimax: Show Journal Statistics to see:  [[cmd:scimax.journal.stats]] #+begin_example Total entries: 45 | Total words: 32,450 | Current streak: 7 days | Longest streak: 12 days #+end_example

entries.heading: Entry Count
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 14:18] Total number of journal entries you've written.

entries.heading: Total Words
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 14:18] Combined word count across all entries. Only counts actual words, not markup.

entries.heading: Current Streak
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 14:18] Number of consecutive days you've written an entry (including today or ending yesterday).

entries.heading: Longest Streak
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 14:18] Your best streak of consecutive journaling days.

entries.heading: Streak Calculation
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 14:18] A streak is maintained if you create entries on consecutive days: - Writing today extends your streak - Missing today but having written yesterday keeps the streak at yesterday's count - Missing two days in a row breaks the streak The streak counter helps build a journaling habit through positive reinforcement.

entries.heading: Status Bar Integration
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-18 Sun 12:52] The status bar (bottom of window) shows journal information: When viewing a journal entry: #+begin_example  Tue 01/14 | 450 words | 3/5 tasks #+end_example When viewing other files: #+begin_example  Journal | 7 day streak #+end_example Click the status bar item to quickly open today's journal. Hover over it to see: - Total entries - Total words - Quick link to today's entry

entries.heading: Agenda Integration
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 14:20] Journal entries are automatically indexed by the Scimax database if your journal directory is included in the search scope. This means journal entries with TODO items, scheduled items, and deadlines will appear in: - Scimax: Show Agenda - Daily agenda view - Scimax: Show TODO Items - All TODO items - Scimax: Show Upcoming Deadlines - Deadline tracking The journal directory is automatically included in both the agenda and database indexing by default (via =scimax.ag

entries.heading: Cross-Referencing
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 14:20] Use org-mode links to cross-reference between journal entries: #+begin_src org ,* Follow-up from yesterday See [[file:2026/01/13/2026-01-13.org::*Meeting Notes][yesterday's meeting notes]] for context. #+end_src Or use relative paths: #+begin_src org [[file:../13/2026-01-13.org][Previous entry]] #+end_src

entries.heading: Embedding Code Blocks
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 14:20] Journal entries support full Babel functionality. Execute code blocks directly in your journal: #+begin_src org ,* Analysis for Today ,#+begin_src python import pandas as pd data = pd.read_csv('daily_metrics.csv') print(data.describe()) ,#+end_src #+end_src Press C-<return> (s-<return> on Mac) to execute blocks. See [[file:07-source-blocks.org][Source Blocks documentation]] for details.

entries.heading: Citations and References
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 14:20] Use org-ref features to add citations to journal entries: #+begin_src org ,* Reading Notes Read interesting paper about neural networks cite:lecun2015deep. The architecture described in cite:he2016deep could be useful for our project. ,* References bibliography:~/references.bib #+end_src Press C-c ] to insert citations. See [[file:19-references.org][References documentation]] for details.

entries.heading: All Journal Commands
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 14:20] | Command                         | Keybinding | Description                          | |---------------------------------+------------+--------------------------------------| | Scimax: Open Today's Journal    | C-S-J      | Open or create today's entry         | | Scimax: New Journal Entry       | -          | Create entry with template selection | | Scimax: Previous Journal Entry  | Cmd-[      | Navigate to previous entry           | | Scimax: Next Journal Entry

entries.heading: Command Palette
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 14:23] Access all commands via Command Palette (C-S-P): 1. Press C-S-P 2. Type "journal" 3. Select command from filtered list

entries.heading: Default Keybindings
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 14:23] #+begin_src json { "command": "scimax.journal.today", "key": "ctrl+shift+j", "mac": "cmd+shift+j" } { "command": "scimax.journal.prev", "key": "alt+[", "when": "resourceFilename =~ /^\\d{4}-\\d{2}-\\d{2}\\.(org|md)$/" } { "command": "scimax.journal.next", "key": "alt+]", "when": "resourceFilename =~ /^\\d{4}-\\d{2}-\\d{2}\\.(org|md)$/" } #+end_src

entries.heading: Custom Keybindings
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 14:23] Add custom keybindings in keybindings.json (File > Preferences > Keyboard Shortcuts, then click the icon in the top right): #+begin_src json { "key": "ctrl+alt+l", "command": "scimax.journal.quickLog" } { "key": "ctrl+alt+t", "command": "scimax.journal.insertTimestamp" } { "key": "ctrl+alt+c", "command": "scimax.journal.calendar" } #+end_src

entries.heading: Daily Journaling Workflow
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 14:21] 1. *Morning*: Open today's journal (C-S-J), review yesterday's entry (M-[), plan today's tasks 2. *Throughout the day*: Use quick log (Scimax: Quick Log Entry) to capture notes 3. *Evening*: Review entry, mark tasks complete, add reflections 4. *Weekly*: Use This Week's Entries to review the week

entries.heading: Building the Habit
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 14:21] - Set a reminder to journal at the same time each day - Start small - even a single sentence counts - Watch your streak grow for motivation - Use the minimal template if the default feels overwhelming - Pin the Journal tree view for easy access

entries.heading: Organizing Information
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 14:21] - Use consistent heading structures for easier searching - Tag entries with hashtags: #projectname #meeting #idea - Link related entries together - Use the Log section for quick captures, Notes for longer form - Create custom templates for recurring entry types

entries.heading: Performance Tips
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 14:21] - The journal system caches entries for 30 seconds, so browsing is fast - Large journals (1000+ entries) may take a moment to load the tree view - Search is optimized but searching "all entries" on large journals may be slow - Statistics are cached for 1 minute and updated asynchronously

entries.heading: Backup and Sync
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 14:21] Since journal entries are plain text files in a standard directory structure: - Easy to backup with any file backup system - Can sync via Dropbox, iCloud, or git - Simple to migrate or export - Future-proof format (plain text) Example git setup for version control: #+begin_src bash cd ~/scimax-journal git init echo ".scimax/cache" > .gitignore git add . git commit -m "Initial journal" #+end_src Then periodically: #+begin_src bash cd ~/scimax-journal git add . git c

entries.heading: Privacy and Security
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 14:21] Journal entries are stored as plain text on your local filesystem. For sensitive information: - Encrypt your journal directory using OS-level encryption - Use a private git repository if syncing - Consider using org-crypt for encrypting specific entries - Be mindful of what you commit to version control

entries.heading: Journal Directory Not Found
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 14:21] If you see errors about missing directory: 1. Check scimax.journal.directory setting 2. Ensure the parent directory exists 3. Restart VS Code 4. The directory will be created automatically on first use

entries.heading: Templates Not Working
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 14:22] If custom templates aren't appearing: 1. Verify template location: <journal-directory>/.scimax/templates/ 2. Check file extension matches format (.org for org-mode, .md for Markdown) 3. Run Scimax: Refresh Journal View 4. Restart VS Code

entries.heading: Navigation Shortcuts Not Working
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 14:22] M-[ and M-] only work when: - Current file is a journal entry - Filename matches YYYY-MM-DD.org or YYYY-MM-DD.md - File is inside the configured journal directory

entries.heading: Statistics Not Updating
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 14:22] Statistics are cached for performance: - Refresh calendar view to force update - Statistics update automatically after 1 minute - Saving a journal file triggers update

entries.heading: Calendar Not Showing Entries
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 14:22] If the calendar appears empty: 1. Check that entries exist in the correct directory structure 2. Run Scimax: Refresh Journal View 3. Verify file naming matches YYYY-MM-DD.org or .md 4. Check for file system permissions issues

entries.heading: Scripting and Automation
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 14:22] Since journal entries are plain text files in a predictable structure, you can script operations:

entries.heading: Auto-generate Weekly Summary
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 14:22] #+begin_src python #!/usr/bin/env python3 import os from datetime import datetime, timedelta import glob journal_dir = os.path.expanduser("~/scimax-journal") today = datetime.now() week_start = today - timedelta(days=today.weekday()) # Collect this week's entries entries = [] for i in range(7): day = week_start + timedelta(days=i) path = os.path.join( journal_dir, f"{day.year}/{day.month:02d}/{day.day:02d}", f"{day.year}-{day.month:02d}-{day.day:02d}.org"

entries.heading: Export to PDF
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 14:22] #+begin_src bash #!/bin/bash # Export recent journal entries to PDF cd ~/scimax-journal # Find entries from last 30 days find . -name "*.org" -mtime -30 | while read file; do pandoc "$file" -o "${file%.org}.pdf" done #+end_src

entries.heading: Custom Template Variables
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 14:22] Currently, template variables are fixed, but you can post-process entries: #+begin_src bash # Add custom metadata after creation sed -i '3i#+TAGS: daily' ~/scimax-journal/2026/01/14/2026-01-14.org #+end_src

entries.heading: Obsidian Daily Notes
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 14:22] To use the same directory structure with Obsidian: 1. Set Obsidian's daily notes folder to your journal directory 2. Use the same date format (YYYY-MM-DD) 3. Adjust template format as needed

entries.heading: Emacs org-journal
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 14:22] The directory structure is compatible with some org-journal configurations: #+begin_src elisp (setq org-journal-dir "~/scimax-journal" org-journal-file-format "%Y-%m-%d.org" org-journal-file-type 'daily) #+end_src

entries.heading: Future Enhancements
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 14:22] Potential future features under consideration: - Weekly and monthly journal entries (not just daily) - Journal entry templates based on day of week - Automatic tagging based on content - Integration with time tracking - Habit tracking visualizations - Export entire journal to single file - Import from other journal systems - Template preview before creation - AI-powered journal prompts and summaries

entries.heading: See Also
