entries.heading: Introduction
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 17:35] Scimax VS Code provides extensive configuration options to customize your scientific computing environment. This guide covers all available settings and provides examples for common use cases.

entries.heading: Accessing Settings
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 17:35] There are multiple ways to access and modify Scimax settings: 1. *Settings UI*: Press `C/Cmd-,' to open the VS Code settings interface. Search for "scimax" to see all Scimax-related settings. 2. *settings.json*: Edit your settings file directly for more control: - Press `C-S-P' (or `s-S-P') and search for "Preferences: Open Settings (JSON)" - Or click the settings icon () in the top-right of the Settings UI and select "Open Settings (JSON)"

entries.heading: Settings File Locations
entries.content: VS Code uses two types of settings files: | Type      | Scope                  | Location                                                       | |-----------+------------------------+----------------------------------------------------------------| | User      | All workspaces         | Linux: ~/.config/Code/User/settings.json                     | |           |                        | macOS: ~/Library/Application Support/Code/User/settings.json | |           |                        | Windows

entries.heading: Settings Format
entries.content: All Scimax settings use JSON format in `settings.json': #+begin_src json { "scimax.journal.directory": "~/my-journal", "scimax.journal.format": "org", "scimax.db.autoIndex": true } #+end_src

entries.heading: General Settings
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-21 Wed 08:00] General settings that apply across Scimax features.

entries.heading: Settings Overview
entries.content: | Setting       | Type   | Default | Description                            | |---------------+--------+---------+----------------------------------------| | scimax.email  | string | ""      | Email for API integrations (OpenAlex)  |

entries.heading: scimax.email
entries.content: - *Type*: string - *Default*: `""' (empty) - *Description*: Your email address for Scimax API integrations This email is used for services that offer better access to identified users. Currently used for: - *OpenAlex*: Setting your email gives you access to the [[https://docs.openalex.org/how-to-use-the-api/rate-limits-and-authentication#the-polite-pool][polite pool]] with faster rate limits *Example*: #+begin_src json { "scimax.email": "user@example.com" } #+end_src You can also configure this

entries.heading: Org-mode Settings
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-24 Sat 17:40] Settings for org-mode document behavior including TODO states, progress logging, and more.

entries.heading: Settings Overview
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-24 Sat 17:41] | Setting                    | Type                 | Default  | Description                     | |----------------------------+----------------------+----------+---------------------------------| | scimax.org.logRepeat       | string (enum)        | "false"  | Enable progress logging         | | scimax.org.logIntoDrawer   | boolean or string    | false    | Where to log state changes      |

entries.heading: scimax.org.logRepeat
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-24 Sat 17:41] - *Type*: string - *Values*: ="false"=, ="time"=, ="note"= - *Default*: ="false"= - *Description*: Controls logging when repeating tasks cycle back to TODO When a repeating task (one with a repeater like =+1w= in its DEADLINE or SCHEDULED timestamp) is marked done, it cycles back to TODO. This setting controls whether to log that completion. | Value     | Behavior                                | |-----------+-----------------------------------------| | ="false"= |

entries.heading: scimax.org.logIntoDrawer
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-24 Sat 17:41] - *Type*: boolean or string - *Default*: =false= - *Description*: Where to log state changes | Value           | Behavior                              | |-----------------+---------------------------------------| | =false=         | Log in body text after properties     | | =true=          | Log into =:LOGBOOK:= drawer           | | ="CUSTOMNAME"=  | Log into custom-named drawer          | *Example*: #+begin_src json { "scimax.org.logIntoDrawer": true } #+end_src *

entries.heading: Journal Settings
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 17:36] Configure the journal system for daily note-taking and logging.

entries.heading: Settings Overview
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 17:36] | Setting                      | Type    | Default      | Description                          | |------------------------------+---------+--------------+--------------------------------------| | scimax.journal.directory     | string  | ""           | Directory for journal files          | | scimax.journal.format        | string  | "org"        | File format (org or markdown)        | | scimax.journal.template      | string  | "default"    | Template name for new e

entries.heading: scimax.journal.directory
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 17:36] - *Type*: string - *Default*: `""' (uses `~/scimax-journal') - *Description*: Directory where journal files are stored *Example*: #+begin_src json { "scimax.journal.directory": "~/Documents/journal" } #+end_src

entries.heading: scimax.journal.format
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 17:37] - *Type*: string (enum) - *Default*: `"org"' - *Options*: `"org"', `"markdown"' - *Description*: File format for journal entries *Example*: #+begin_src json { "scimax.journal.format": "markdown" } #+end_src

entries.heading: scimax.journal.template
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 17:37] - *Type*: string - *Default*: `"default"' - *Description*: Template name for new journal entries. Create custom templates in your journal directory. *Example*: #+begin_src json { "scimax.journal.template": "daily-standup" } #+end_src

entries.heading: scimax.journal.dateFormat
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 17:37] - *Type*: string - *Default*: `"YYYY-MM-DD"' - *Description*: Date format for journal file names using date-fns tokens *Common formats*: - `YYYY-MM-DD'  2026-01-14 - `YYYY/MM/DD'  2026/01/14 - `YYYYMMDD'  20260114 *Example*: #+begin_src json { "scimax.journal.dateFormat": "YYYY/MM/DD" } #+end_src

entries.heading: scimax.journal.autoTimestamp
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 17:37] - *Type*: boolean - *Default*: `true' - *Description*: Automatically insert timestamps when creating log entries *Example*: #+begin_src json { "scimax.journal.autoTimestamp": false } #+end_src

entries.heading: scimax.journal.weekStartsOn
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 17:37] - *Type*: string (enum) - *Default*: `"monday"' - *Options*: `"monday"', `"sunday"' - *Description*: First day of the week in calendar view *Example*: #+begin_src json { "scimax.journal.weekStartsOn": "sunday" } #+end_src

entries.heading: Database & Search Settings
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 17:37] Configure the full-text search database and semantic search capabilities.

entries.heading: Settings Overview
entries.content: | Setting                     | Type    | Default                   | Description                            | |-----------------------------+---------+---------------------------+----------------------------------------| | scimax.db.includeJournal    | boolean | true                      | Include journal directory              | | scimax.db.includeWorkspace  | boolean | true                      | Include workspace folders              | | scimax.db.includeProjects   | boolean | true

entries.heading: scimax.db.includeJournal
entries.content: - *Type*: boolean - *Default*: =true= - *Description*: Include the journal directory in database indexing

entries.heading: scimax.db.includeWorkspace
entries.content: - *Type*: boolean - *Default*: =true= - *Description*: Include workspace folders in database indexing

entries.heading: scimax.db.includeProjects
entries.content: - *Type*: boolean - *Default*: =true= - *Description*: Include all scimax projects in database indexing

entries.heading: scimax.db.include
entries.content: - *Type*: array of strings - *Default*: =[ ]= - *Description*: Additional directories or files to index (supports ~ for home directory) *Example*: #+begin_src json { "scimax.db.include": [ "~/Documents/notes", "~/research", "~/teaching/courses" ] } #+end_src

entries.heading: scimax.db.exclude
entries.content: - *Type*: array of strings - *Default*: =["**/node_modules/**", "**/.git/**", "**/dist/**", "**/build/**"]= - *Description*: Patterns or paths to exclude from indexing (globs and absolute paths) *Example*: #+begin_src json { "scimax.db.exclude": [ "**/node_modules/**", "**/.git/**", "**/dist/**", "**/build/**", "**/archive/**", "~/notes/scratch.org" ] } #+end_src

entries.heading: scimax.db.autoIndex
entries.content: - *Type*: boolean - *Default*: `false' - *Description*: Automatically index workspace files on activation. *Warning*: Disable for large workspaces to prevent memory issues. *Example*: #+begin_src json { "scimax.db.autoIndex": true } #+end_src

entries.heading: scimax.db.embeddingProvider
entries.content: - *Type*: string (enum) - *Default*: `"ollama"' - *Options*: `"none"', `"ollama"' - *Description*: Embedding provider for semantic/AI-powered search - `none': No semantic search (text-only) - `ollama': Use local Ollama server (recommended) *Example*: #+begin_src json { "scimax.db.embeddingProvider": "ollama" } #+end_src

entries.heading: scimax.db.ollamaUrl
entries.content: - *Type*: string - *Default*: `"http://localhost:11434"' - *Description*: Ollama API URL for embeddings *Example*: #+begin_src json { "scimax.db.embeddingProvider": "ollama", "scimax.db.ollamaUrl": "http://localhost:11434" } #+end_src

entries.heading: scimax.db.ollamaModel
entries.content: - *Type*: string - *Default*: `"nomic-embed-text"' - *Description*: Ollama model name for embeddings. Must be installed in Ollama. *Example*: #+begin_src json { "scimax.db.embeddingProvider": "ollama", "scimax.db.ollamaModel": "nomic-embed-text" } #+end_src

entries.heading: scimax.db.queryTimeoutMs
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-22 Thu 21:23] - *Type*: number - *Default*: =30000= (30 seconds) - *Range*: 5000 - 300000 - *Description*: Maximum time in milliseconds for database queries. Prevents hung operations. Increase this value if you have a very large database or slow disk: *Example*: #+begin_src json { "scimax.db.queryTimeoutMs": 60000 } #+end_src

entries.heading: scimax.db.maxRetryAttempts
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-22 Thu 21:23] - *Type*: number - *Default*: =3= - *Range*: 1 - 10 - *Description*: Maximum retry attempts for transient database failures (e.g., database locked, I/O errors). Uses exponential backoff between retries. *Example*: #+begin_src json { "scimax.db.maxRetryAttempts": 5 } #+end_src

entries.heading: scimax.db.maxFileSizeMB
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-22 Thu 21:24] - *Type*: number - *Default*: =10= - *Range*: 1 - 100 - *Description*: Maximum file size in MB to index. Files larger than this are skipped. Useful when working with external repositories or collaborator files that may contain large generated files: *Example*: #+begin_src json { "scimax.db.maxFileSizeMB": 20 } #+end_src

entries.heading: Logging Settings
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-22 Thu 21:23] Configure logging and diagnostics.

entries.heading: Settings Overview
entries.content: | Setting              | Type   | Default | Description                          | |----------------------+--------+---------+--------------------------------------| | scimax.logLevel      | string | "info"  | Log level for Scimax output          | | scimax.logMaxSizeKB  | number | 1024    | Max log file size before rotation    | | scimax.logBackupCount| number | 3       | Number of backup log files to keep   |

entries.heading: scimax.logLevel
entries.content: - *Type*: string - *Default*: ="info"= - *Enum*: ="debug"=, ="info"=, ="warn"=, ="error"= - *Description*: Controls the verbosity of logging to the Scimax output channel. | Level   | Shows                                         | |---------+-----------------------------------------------| | debug   | All messages including detailed debug info    | | info    | Normal operation messages                     | | warn    | Warnings and errors only                      | | error   | Errors only

entries.heading: scimax.logMaxSizeKB
entries.content: - *Type*: number - *Default*: =1024= (1MB) - *Min/Max*: 100 - 10240 - *Description*: Maximum size of each log file in KB before rotation. Logs are written to the extension's storage directory.

entries.heading: scimax.logBackupCount
entries.content: - *Type*: number - *Default*: =3= - *Min/Max*: 1 - 10 - *Description*: Number of rotated log backup files to keep (=scimax.log.1=, =scimax.log.2=, etc.). Oldest backup is deleted when limit is reached.

entries.heading: Opening Log Files
entries.content: Use the command =Scimax: Open Log File Directory= to open the directory containing log files for debugging. *Example*: #+begin_src json { "scimax.logLevel": "debug", "scimax.logMaxSizeKB": 2048, "scimax.logBackupCount": 5 } #+end_src

entries.heading: Code Execution Settings
entries.content: Configure Python and Jupyter paths for source block execution.

entries.heading: Settings Overview
entries.content: | Setting                      | Type   | Default | Description                        | |------------------------------+--------+---------+------------------------------------| | scimax.literate.pythonPath | string | ""    | Path to Python executable          | | scimax.literate.jupyterPath | string | ""    | Path to Jupyter executable         |

entries.heading: scimax.literate.pythonPath
entries.content: - *Type*: string - *Default*: `""' (uses system Python) - *Description*: Path to Python executable for code block execution *Example*: #+begin_src json { "scimax.literate.pythonPath": "/usr/local/bin/python3" } #+end_src Or with virtual environment: #+begin_src json { "scimax.literate.pythonPath": "~/projects/myproject/.venv/bin/python" } #+end_src

entries.heading: scimax.literate.jupyterPath
entries.content: - *Type*: string - *Default*: `""' (uses system Jupyter) - *Description*: Path to Jupyter executable *Example*: #+begin_src json { "scimax.literate.jupyterPath": "~/anaconda3/bin/jupyter" } #+end_src

entries.heading: Reference/Citation Settings
entries.content: Configure bibliography management and citation styles.

entries.heading: Settings Overview
entries.content: | Setting                      | Type   | Default | Description                   | |------------------------------+--------+---------+-------------------------------| | scimax.ref.bibliographyFiles | array  | [ ]     | Paths to BibTeX files         | | scimax.ref.pdfDirectory      | string | ""      | Directory with PDF files      | | scimax.ref.notesDirectory    | string | ""      | Directory for reference notes | | scimax.ref.defaultCiteStyle  | string | "cite"  | Default citation style

entries.heading: scimax.ref.bibliographyFiles
entries.content: - *Type*: array of strings - *Default*: `[ ]' - *Description*: Paths to BibTeX bibliography files *Example*: #+begin_src json { "scimax.ref.bibliographyFiles": [ "~/Documents/bibliography/main.bib", "~/research/papers.bib" ] } #+end_src

entries.heading: scimax.ref.pdfDirectory
entries.content: - *Type*: string - *Default*: `""' - *Description*: Directory containing PDF files for references *Example*: #+begin_src json { "scimax.ref.pdfDirectory": "~/Documents/papers" } #+end_src

entries.heading: scimax.ref.notesDirectory
entries.content: - *Type*: string - *Default*: `""' - *Description*: Directory for reference notes and annotations *Example*: #+begin_src json { "scimax.ref.notesDirectory": "~/Documents/notes/references" } #+end_src

entries.heading: scimax.ref.defaultCiteStyle
entries.content: - *Type*: string (enum) - *Default*: `"cite"' - *Options*: `"cite"', `"citet"', `"citep"', `"citeauthor"', `"citeyear"' - *Description*: Default citation style for insertions - `cite': Generic citation - `citet': Textual citation (Author (Year)) - `citep': Parenthetical citation ((Author, Year)) - `citeauthor': Author only - `citeyear': Year only *Example*: #+begin_src json { "scimax.ref.defaultCiteStyle": "citep" } #+end_src

entries.heading: Export Settings
entries.content: Configure LaTeX and PDF export options.

entries.heading: LaTeX Export Settings
entries.content: | Setting                             | Type   | Default           | Description                      | |-------------------------------------+--------+-------------------+----------------------------------| | scimax.export.latex.customHeader    | string | ""                | Custom LaTeX preamble            | | scimax.export.latex.documentClass   | string | "article"         | Default document class           | | scimax.export.latex.classOptions    | string | "12pt,letterpaper"| Default class o

entries.heading: scimax.export.latex.customHeader
scimax.export.latex.documentClass
entries.content: - *Type*: string - *Default*: `"article"' - *Description*: Default LaTeX document class. Can be overridden by =#+LATEX_CLASS:= in the document. *Example*: #+begin_src json { "scimax.export.latex.documentClass": "report" } #+end_src

entries.heading: scimax.export.latex.classOptions
entries.content: - *Type*: string - *Default*: `"12pt,letterpaper"' - *Description*: Default LaTeX class options. Can be overridden by =#+LATEX_CLASS_OPTIONS:= in the document. *Example*: #+begin_src json { "scimax.export.latex.classOptions": "11pt,a4paper,twoside" } #+end_src

entries.heading: scimax.export.latex.defaultPreamble
entries.content: - *Type*: string - *Default*: Standard academic packages (inputenc, graphicx, amsmath, etc.) - *Description*: Default LaTeX preamble packages. Can be extended by =#+LATEX_HEADER:= in the document. *Example*: #+begin_src json { "scimax.export.latex.defaultPreamble": "\\usepackage[utf8]{inputenc}\n\\usepackage{graphicx}\n\\usepackage{amsmath}" } #+end_src

entries.heading: PDF Export Settings
entries.content: | Setting                         | Type    | Default           | Description                      | |---------------------------------+---------+-------------------+----------------------------------| | scimax.export.pdf.compiler      | string  | "latexmk-lualatex"| LaTeX compiler for PDF           | | scimax.export.pdf.bibtexCommand | string  | "bibtex"          | Bibliography processor           | | scimax.export.pdf.shellEscape   | string  | "restricted"      | Shell escape mode

entries.heading: scimax.export.pdf.compiler
entries.content: - *Type*: string (enum) - *Default*: `"latexmk-lualatex"' - *Options*: `"latexmk-lualatex"', `"latexmk-pdflatex"', `"latexmk-xelatex"', `"lualatex"', `"pdflatex"', `"xelatex"' - *Description*: LaTeX compiler to use for PDF generation - =latexmk-*=: Uses latexmk which automatically handles multiple passes for references and bibliography (recommended) - Direct compilers: Manual handling of bibliography passes *Example*: #+begin_src json { "scimax.export.pdf.compiler": "latexmk-xelatex" } #+end_src

entries.heading: scimax.export.pdf.bibtexCommand
entries.content: - *Type*: string (enum) - *Default*: `"bibtex"' - *Options*: `"biber"', `"bibtex"' - *Description*: Bibliography processor (only used when not using latexmk) - =bibtex=: Traditional, works with .bst styles - =biber=: Modern, required for biblatex *Example*: #+begin_src json { "scimax.export.pdf.bibtexCommand": "biber" } #+end_src

entries.heading: scimax.export.pdf.shellEscape
entries.content: - *Type*: string (enum) - *Default*: `"restricted"' - *Options*: `"restricted"', `"full"', `"disabled"' - *Description*: Shell escape mode for LaTeX compilation - =restricted=: Allows minted/pygments but blocks dangerous commands (safe default) - =full=: Allows all shell commands (security risk, but needed for some packages) - =disabled=: No shell escape *Example*: #+begin_src json { "scimax.export.pdf.shellEscape": "full" } #+end_src

entries.heading: scimax.export.pdf.extraArgs
entries.content: - *Type*: string - *Default*: `""' - *Description*: Extra arguments to pass to the LaTeX compiler *Example*: #+begin_src json { "scimax.export.pdf.extraArgs": "-synctex=1" } #+end_src

entries.heading: scimax.export.pdf.openLogOnError
entries.content: - *Type*: boolean - *Default*: `true' - *Description*: Automatically open the log file when PDF compilation fails

entries.heading: scimax.export.pdf.cleanAuxFiles
entries.content: - *Type*: boolean - *Default*: `true' - *Description*: Clean up auxiliary files (.aux, .bbl, .blg, etc.) after successful compilation

entries.heading: LaTeX Preview Settings
entries.content: Configure inline LaTeX equation previews.

entries.heading: Settings Overview
entries.content: | Setting                           | Type    | Default | Description                      | |-----------------------------------+---------+---------+----------------------------------| | scimax.latexPreview.enabled       | boolean | true    | Enable LaTeX preview on hover    | | scimax.latexPreview.cacheEnabled  | boolean | true    | Cache rendered equations         | | scimax.latexPreview.darkModeAware | boolean | true    | Adjust rendering for dark themes |

entries.heading: scimax.latexPreview.enabled
entries.content: - *Type*: boolean - *Default*: `true' - *Description*: Enable LaTeX equation preview on hover *Example*: #+begin_src json { "scimax.latexPreview.enabled": true } #+end_src

entries.heading: scimax.latexPreview.cacheEnabled
entries.content: - *Type*: boolean - *Default*: `true' - *Description*: Cache rendered equations for faster hover responses *Example*: #+begin_src json { "scimax.latexPreview.cacheEnabled": true } #+end_src

entries.heading: scimax.latexPreview.darkModeAware
entries.content: - *Type*: boolean - *Default*: `true' - *Description*: Automatically adjust equation rendering for dark/light themes *Example*: #+begin_src json { "scimax.latexPreview.darkModeAware": true } #+end_src

entries.heading: LaTeX Live Preview Settings
entries.content: Configure automatic PDF building and live preview.

entries.heading: Settings Overview
entries.content: | Setting                             | Type    | Default    | Description                    | |-------------------------------------+---------+------------+--------------------------------| | scimax.latexLivePreview.buildOnSave | boolean | true       | Auto-rebuild PDF on save       | | scimax.latexLivePreview.buildOnIdle | boolean | false      | Auto-rebuild after idle period | | scimax.latexLivePreview.idleDelay   | number  | 2000       | Idle delay in milliseconds     | | scimax.latexLivePr

entries.heading: scimax.latexLivePreview.buildOnSave
entries.content: - *Type*: boolean - *Default*: `true' - *Description*: Automatically rebuild PDF when the org file is saved *Example*: #+begin_src json { "scimax.latexLivePreview.buildOnSave": true } #+end_src

entries.heading: scimax.latexLivePreview.buildOnIdle
entries.content: - *Type*: boolean - *Default*: `false' - *Description*: Automatically rebuild PDF after idle period (no typing) *Example*: #+begin_src json { "scimax.latexLivePreview.buildOnIdle": true, "scimax.latexLivePreview.idleDelay": 3000 } #+end_src

entries.heading: scimax.latexLivePreview.idleDelay
entries.content: - *Type*: number - *Default*: `2000' - *Description*: Delay in milliseconds before idle build triggers *Example*: #+begin_src json { "scimax.latexLivePreview.buildOnIdle": true, "scimax.latexLivePreview.idleDelay": 5000 } #+end_src

entries.heading: scimax.latexLivePreview.compiler
entries.content: - *Type*: string (enum) - *Default*: `"pdflatex"' - *Options*: `"pdflatex"', `"xelatex"', `"lualatex"' - *Description*: LaTeX compiler to use - `pdflatex': Standard, fast - `xelatex': Better Unicode and font support - `lualatex': Modern, Lua scripting support *Example*: #+begin_src json { "scimax.latexLivePreview.compiler": "xelatex" } #+end_src

entries.heading: scimax.latexLivePreview.useLatexmk
entries.content: - *Type*: boolean - *Default*: `true' - *Description*: Use latexmk for smart incremental builds (recommended). Automatically handles multiple passes for references, bibliography, etc. *Example*: #+begin_src json { "scimax.latexLivePreview.useLatexmk": true } #+end_src

entries.heading: Notebook Settings
entries.content: Configure the project-based notebook system.

entries.heading: Settings Overview
entries.content: | Setting                         | Type    | Default    | Description              | |---------------------------------+---------+------------+--------------------------| | scimax.notebook.directory       | string  | ""         | Default parent directory | | scimax.notebook.defaultTemplate | string  | "research" | Default template         | | scimax.notebook.autoDetect      | boolean | true       | Auto-detect projects     |

entries.heading: scimax.notebook.directory
entries.content: - *Type*: string - *Default*: `""' - *Description*: Default parent directory for new notebooks *Example*: #+begin_src json { "scimax.notebook.directory": "~/projects" } #+end_src

entries.heading: scimax.notebook.defaultTemplate
entries.content: - *Type*: string (enum) - *Default*: `"research"' - *Options*: `"empty"', `"research"', `"software"', `"notes"' - *Description*: Default template for new notebooks - `empty': Minimal structure - `research': Research project layout - `software': Software development layout - `notes': Note-taking layout *Example*: #+begin_src json { "scimax.notebook.defaultTemplate": "software" } #+end_src

entries.heading: scimax.notebook.autoDetect
entries.content: - *Type*: boolean - *Default*: `true' - *Description*: Automatically detect and track projects in workspace *Example*: #+begin_src json { "scimax.notebook.autoDetect": false } #+end_src

entries.heading: Hydra Menu Settings
entries.content: Configure the Hydra menu system for quick command access.

entries.heading: Settings Overview
entries.content: | Setting                         | Type    | Default | Description                     | |---------------------------------+---------+---------+---------------------------------| | scimax.hydra.showKeyHints       | boolean | true    | Show keyboard shortcuts inline  | | scimax.hydra.singleKeySelection | boolean | true    | Single keypress selection       | | scimax.hydra.dimNonMatching     | boolean | true    | Dim non-matching items          | | scimax.hydra.sortByKey          | boolean | fals

entries.heading: scimax.hydra.showKeyHints
entries.content: - *Type*: boolean - *Default*: `true' - *Description*: Show keyboard shortcuts inline with menu items *Example*: #+begin_src json { "scimax.hydra.showKeyHints": true } #+end_src

entries.heading: scimax.hydra.singleKeySelection
entries.content: - *Type*: boolean - *Default*: `true' - *Description*: Select menu items with a single keypress (no Enter needed) *Example*: #+begin_src json { "scimax.hydra.singleKeySelection": true } #+end_src

entries.heading: scimax.hydra.dimNonMatching
entries.content: - *Type*: boolean - *Default*: `true' - *Description*: Dim menu items that don't match the current filter *Example*: #+begin_src json { "scimax.hydra.dimNonMatching": true } #+end_src

entries.heading: scimax.hydra.sortByKey
entries.content: - *Type*: boolean - *Default*: `false' - *Description*: Sort menu items by their keyboard shortcut instead of logical grouping *Example*: #+begin_src json { "scimax.hydra.sortByKey": false } #+end_src

entries.heading: Speed Commands Settings
entries.content: Configure org-mode style speed commands.

entries.heading: Settings Overview
entries.content: | Setting                      | Type    | Default | Description                            | |------------------------------+---------+---------+----------------------------------------| | scimax.speedCommands.enabled | boolean | true    | Enable speed commands at heading start |

entries.heading: scimax.speedCommands.enabled
entries.content: - *Type*: boolean - *Default*: `true' - *Description*: Enable org-mode speed commands (single-key shortcuts at beginning of headings) When enabled, you can use single-key shortcuts (like `n', `p', `u') when the cursor is at the beginning of a heading line. *Example*: #+begin_src json { "scimax.speedCommands.enabled": true } #+end_src

entries.heading: Agenda Settings
entries.content: Configure the agenda view and TODO tracking.

entries.heading: Settings Overview
entries.content: | Setting                        | Type    | Default                     | Description                    | |--------------------------------+---------+-----------------------------+--------------------------------| | scimax.agenda.includeJournal   | boolean | true                        | Include journal in agenda      | | scimax.agenda.includeWorkspace | boolean | true                        | Include workspace folders      | | scimax.agenda.includeProjects  | boolean | true

entries.heading: scimax.agenda.includeJournal
entries.content: - *Type*: boolean - *Default*: =true= - *Description*: Include the journal directory in agenda scanning When enabled, the journal directory (from =scimax.journal.directory=) is automatically included in agenda scanning. Disable this if you don't want journal entries in your agenda.

entries.heading: scimax.agenda.includeWorkspace
entries.content: - *Type*: boolean - *Default*: =true= - *Description*: Include workspace folders in agenda scanning

entries.heading: scimax.agenda.includeProjects
entries.content: - *Type*: boolean - *Default*: =true= - *Description*: Include all scimax projects in agenda scanning When enabled, all projects registered with scimax projectile are included in agenda scanning. This is useful because projects often contain TODO items and tasks.

entries.heading: scimax.agenda.include
entries.content: - *Type*: array of strings - *Default*: =[ ]= (empty) - *Description*: Additional directories or files to include in the agenda (supports ~ for home directory) *Example*: #+begin_src json { "scimax.agenda.include": [ "~/Documents/org", "~/work/projects" ] } #+end_src

entries.heading: scimax.agenda.exclude
entries.content: - *Type*: array of strings - *Default*: =["**/node_modules/**", "**/.git/**", "**/archive/**"]= - *Description*: Patterns or paths to exclude from agenda scanning. Supports both glob patterns (containing =*=) and absolute paths. *Example*: #+begin_src json { "scimax.agenda.exclude": [ "**/node_modules/**", "**/.git/**", "**/archive/**", "~/org/scratch.org" ] } #+end_src

entries.heading: scimax.agenda.defaultSpan
entries.content: - *Type*: number - *Default*: `7' - *Description*: Default number of days to show in agenda view *Example*: #+begin_src json { "scimax.agenda.defaultSpan": 14 } #+end_src

entries.heading: scimax.agenda.showDone
entries.content: - *Type*: boolean - *Default*: `false' - *Description*: Show completed (DONE) items in agenda view *Example*: #+begin_src json { "scimax.agenda.showDone": true } #+end_src

entries.heading: scimax.agenda.showHabits
entries.content: - *Type*: boolean - *Default*: `true' - *Description*: Show items tagged with `:HABIT:' *Example*: #+begin_src json { "scimax.agenda.showHabits": false } #+end_src

entries.heading: scimax.agenda.todoStates
entries.content: - *Type*: array of strings - *Default*: `["TODO", "NEXT", "WAITING"]' - *Description*: Active TODO states to show in TODO list *Example*: #+begin_src json { "scimax.agenda.todoStates": [ "TODO", "NEXT", "IN-PROGRESS", "WAITING", "SOMEDAY" ] } #+end_src

entries.heading: scimax.agenda.doneStates
entries.content: - *Type*: array of strings - *Default*: `["DONE", "CANCELLED"]' - *Description*: Completed TODO states *Example*: #+begin_src json { "scimax.agenda.doneStates": [ "DONE", "CANCELLED", "DEFERRED", "ARCHIVED" ] } #+end_src

entries.heading: Image Overlay Settings
entries.content: Configure inline image thumbnails in org-mode files.

entries.heading: Settings Overview
entries.content: | Setting                                      | Type    | Default  | Description                        | |----------------------------------------------+---------+----------+------------------------------------| | scimax.imageOverlays.enabled                 | boolean | true     | Enable inline image thumbnails     | | scimax.imageOverlays.maxWidth                | number  | 96       | Maximum thumbnail width in pixels  | | scimax.imageOverlays.maxHeight               | number  | 96       | Ma

entries.heading: scimax.imageOverlays.enabled
entries.content: - *Type*: boolean - *Default*: `true' - *Description*: Enable inline image thumbnails in org-mode files *Example*: #+begin_src json { "scimax.imageOverlays.enabled": true } #+end_src

entries.heading: scimax.imageOverlays.maxWidth
entries.content: - *Type*: number - *Default*: `96' - *Description*: Maximum width in pixels for thumbnail icons *Example*: #+begin_src json { "scimax.imageOverlays.maxWidth": 128 } #+end_src

entries.heading: scimax.imageOverlays.maxHeight
entries.content: - *Type*: number - *Default*: `96' - *Description*: Maximum height in pixels for thumbnail icons *Example*: #+begin_src json { "scimax.imageOverlays.maxHeight": 128 } #+end_src

entries.heading: scimax.imageOverlays.renderMode
entries.content: - *Type*: string (enum) - *Default*: `"gutter"' - *Options*: `"gutter"', `"after"', `"both"' - *Description*: Where to display image thumbnails - `gutter': In the line margin (gutter) - `after': Inline emoji after the link - `both': Both locations *Example*: #+begin_src json { "scimax.imageOverlays.renderMode": "both" } #+end_src

entries.heading: scimax.imageOverlays.onlyWhenCursorNotInLink
entries.content: - *Type*: boolean - *Default*: `true' - *Description*: Hide overlay when cursor is inside the image link (prevents interference with editing) *Example*: #+begin_src json { "scimax.imageOverlays.onlyWhenCursorNotInLink": true } #+end_src

entries.heading: scimax.imageOverlays.excludePatterns
entries.content: - *Type*: array of strings - *Default*: `[ ]' - *Description*: Regex patterns for image paths to exclude from overlays *Example*: #+begin_src json { "scimax.imageOverlays.excludePatterns": [ ".*\\.ico$", ".*thumbnail.*" ] } #+end_src

entries.heading: scimax.imageOverlays.maxOverlaysPerDocument
entries.content: - *Type*: number - *Default*: `200' - *Description*: Maximum number of image overlays to display per document (prevents performance issues) *Example*: #+begin_src json { "scimax.imageOverlays.maxOverlaysPerDocument": 500 } #+end_src

entries.heading: scimax.imageOverlays.showDimensions
entries.content: - *Type*: boolean - *Default*: `true' - *Description*: Show image dimensions in the after-content decoration *Example*: #+begin_src json { "scimax.imageOverlays.showDimensions": false } #+end_src

entries.heading: scimax.imageOverlays.cacheEnabled
entries.content: - *Type*: boolean - *Default*: `true' - *Description*: Cache generated thumbnails for faster loading *Example*: #+begin_src json { "scimax.imageOverlays.cacheEnabled": true } #+end_src

entries.heading: Capture Settings
entries.content: Configure the org-capture system for quick note-taking.

entries.heading: Settings Overview
entries.content: | Setting                       | Type    | Default           | Description             | |-------------------------------+---------+-------------------+-------------------------| | scimax.capture.templates      | array   | [ ]               | Capture templates       | | scimax.capture.defaultFile    | string  | "~/org/notes.org" | Default capture file    | | scimax.capture.datetreeFormat | string  | "day"             | Datetree granularity    | | scimax.capture.autoSave       | boolean | true

entries.heading: scimax.capture.templates
entries.content: - *Type*: array of objects - *Default*: `[ ]' - *Description*: Capture templates for quick note-taking. Each template has: - `key': Single character shortcut - `name': Template name - `type': entry, item, or table-line - `file': Target file - `headline': Optional target headline - `datetree': Boolean, use datetree structure - `template': Template text with placeholders *Template placeholders*: - `%^{prompt}': Prompt for input - `%t': Current timestamp - `%T': Current timestamp with time - `%i':

entries.heading: scimax.capture.defaultFile
entries.content: - *Type*: string - *Default*: `"~/org/notes.org"' - *Description*: Default file for captures when no target file is specified in template *Example*: #+begin_src json { "scimax.capture.defaultFile": "~/Documents/inbox.org" } #+end_src

entries.heading: scimax.capture.datetreeFormat
entries.content: - *Type*: string (enum) - *Default*: `"day"' - *Options*: `"day"', `"week"', `"month"' - *Description*: Granularity of datetree entries - `day': Year > Month > Day - `week': Year > Week number - `month': Year > Month *Example*: #+begin_src json { "scimax.capture.datetreeFormat": "week" } #+end_src

entries.heading: scimax.capture.autoSave
entries.content: - *Type*: boolean - *Default*: `true' - *Description*: Automatically save the file after capture *Example*: #+begin_src json { "scimax.capture.autoSave": true } #+end_src

entries.heading: Common Configurations
entries.content: This section provides complete `settings.json' examples for different use cases.

entries.heading: Academic Writing Setup
entries.content: Perfect for researchers, graduate students, and academic writers: #+begin_src json { // Journal for daily research log "scimax.journal.directory": "~/research/journal", "scimax.journal.format": "org", "scimax.journal.autoTimestamp": true, // References and bibliography "scimax.ref.bibliographyFiles": [ "~/research/bibliography/main.bib", "~/research/bibliography/conferences.bib" ], "scimax.ref.pdfDirectory": "~/research/papers", "scimax.ref.notesDirectory": "~/research/notes", "scimax.ref.defaul

entries.heading: Software Development Setup
entries.content: Optimized for software developers and programmers: #+begin_src json { // Journal for development log "scimax.journal.directory": "~/devlog", "scimax.journal.format": "markdown", "scimax.journal.template": "daily-standup", // Code execution "scimax.literate.pythonPath": "~/.pyenv/shims/python", "scimax.literate.jupyterPath": "~/.pyenv/shims/jupyter", // Database - index project documentation "scimax.db.include": [ "~/projects", "~/docs" ], "scimax.db.exclude": [ "**/node_modules/**",

entries.heading: Personal Notes & PKM Setup
entries.content: For personal knowledge management and note-taking: #+begin_src json { // Journal "scimax.journal.directory": "~/notes/journal", "scimax.journal.format": "org", "scimax.journal.weekStartsOn": "monday", "scimax.journal.autoTimestamp": true, // Database with semantic search "scimax.db.include": [ "~/notes", "~/books", "~/articles" ], "scimax.db.exclude": [ "**/archive/**", "**/temp/**" ], "scimax.db.autoIndex": true, "scimax.db.embeddingProvider": "ollama", "scimax.db.ollamaModel": "nomic-embed-tex

entries.heading: Minimal Configuration
entries.content: Bare-bones setup with just the essentials: #+begin_src json { "scimax.journal.directory": "~/journal", "scimax.db.autoIndex": false, "scimax.agenda.include": ["~/notes"] } #+end_src

entries.heading: Database Performance
entries.content: If database indexing is slow or uses too much memory: #+begin_src json { "scimax.db.autoIndex": false, "scimax.db.exclude": [ "**/node_modules/**", "**/.git/**", "**/dist/**", "**/build/**", "**/*.min.js", "**/archive/**" ] } #+end_src Then manually trigger indexing with `C-S-P'  "Scimax: Reindex Files"

entries.heading: Jupyter Kernels Not Found
entries.content: Ensure Jupyter is in your PATH or specify the full path: #+begin_src json { "scimax.literate.jupyterPath": "/usr/local/bin/jupyter" } #+end_src Check available kernels with `C-S-P'  "Scimax: Show Available Jupyter Kernels"

entries.heading: LaTeX Preview Not Working
entries.content: Ensure you have a LaTeX distribution installed (TeX Live, MiKTeX, etc.), then: #+begin_src json { "scimax.latexPreview.enabled": true, "scimax.latexPreview.cacheEnabled": false } #+end_src

entries.heading: Semantic Search Not Working
entries.content: Ensure the Ollama server is running and the embedding model is pulled: #+begin_src bash curl http://localhost:11434/api/version #+end_src

entries.heading: Related Documentation
entries.content: - [[file:01-getting-started.org][Getting Started Guide]] - [[file:07-source-blocks.org][Source Blocks Documentation]] - [[file:10-export.org][Export Documentation]] - [[file:24-keybindings.org][Keybindings Reference]]

entries.heading: Navigation
entries.content: - Previous: [[file:25-commands.org][Commands]] - Index: [[file:00-index.org][Documentation Index]] - Next: [[file:27-org-api.org][Org API]]

entries.heading: Introduction
entries.content: CLOSED: [2026-01-17 Sat 17:41] The Org File Modification API provides a TypeScript interface for programmatically reading, modifying, and writing org-mode files. This is the VS Code equivalent of Emacs org-mode's ability to traverse and modify parse trees using elisp. Use this API in TypeScript source blocks to: - Bulk update TODO states across files - Extract and transform data from tables - Rearrange document structure - Generate reports from org data - Automate repetitive org file operations

entries.heading: Basic Example: Change All TODOs to DONE
entries.content: #+BEGIN_SRC typescript :results silent import { org } from 'scimax'; const doc = org.parseFile('./tasks.org'); org.mapHeadlines(doc, h => { if (h.properties.todoKeyword === 'TODO') { org.setTodo(h, 'DONE'); } }); org.writeFile('./tasks.org', doc); #+END_SRC

entries.heading: Query and Report
entries.content: #+BEGIN_SRC typescript :results output import { org } from 'scimax'; const doc = org.parseFile('./projects.org'); const todos = org.query(doc, { hasTodo: true, todoType: 'todo' }); console.log(`Found ${todos.length} pending tasks:`); todos.forEach(h => { console.log(`  - ${h.properties.rawValue}`); }); #+END_SRC

entries.heading: org.parseFile(path, config?)
entries.content: Parse an org file from disk into an AST. #+BEGIN_SRC typescript const doc = org.parseFile('./notes.org'); const doc = org.parseFile('/absolute/path/to/file.org'); #+END_SRC

entries.heading: org.parse(content, config?)
entries.content: Parse org content from a string. #+BEGIN_SRC typescript const doc = org.parse('* TODO My task\nSome content'); #+END_SRC

entries.heading: org.writeFile(path, doc, options?)
entries.content: Write a document AST back to a file. #+BEGIN_SRC typescript org.writeFile('./notes.org', doc); #+END_SRC

entries.heading: org.serialize(doc, options?)
entries.content: Convert a document AST to an org-mode string. #+BEGIN_SRC typescript const orgText = org.serialize(doc); console.log(orgText); #+END_SRC

entries.heading: org.mapHeadlines(doc, callback)
entries.content: Visit every headline in the document (depth-first order). The callback receives: - `headline' - The current headline element - `parent' - Parent headline or document root - `index' - Position among siblings #+BEGIN_SRC typescript org.mapHeadlines(doc, (headline, parent, index) => { console.log(`${headline.properties.level}: ${headline.properties.rawValue}`); }); #+END_SRC

entries.heading: org.filterHeadlines(doc, predicate)
entries.content: Return headlines matching a predicate function. #+BEGIN_SRC typescript const todos = org.filterHeadlines(doc, h => h.properties.todoKeyword === 'TODO' ); #+END_SRC

entries.heading: org.findHeadline(doc, predicate)
entries.content: Find the first headline matching a predicate. #+BEGIN_SRC typescript const intro = org.findHeadline(doc, h => h.properties.rawValue === 'Introduction' ); #+END_SRC

entries.heading: org.getAllHeadlines(doc)
entries.content: Get all headlines as a flat array. #+BEGIN_SRC typescript const all = org.getAllHeadlines(doc); console.log(`Document has ${all.length} headlines`); #+END_SRC

entries.heading: org.mapElements(doc, elementType, callback)
entries.content: Visit all elements of a specific type. #+BEGIN_SRC typescript org.mapElements(doc, 'src-block', (block, parent, index) => { console.log(`Found ${block.properties.language} block`); }); #+END_SRC

entries.heading: org.filterElements(doc, elementType)
entries.content: Filter elements by type. #+BEGIN_SRC typescript const tables = org.filterElements(doc, 'table'); #+END_SRC

entries.heading: org.getSrcBlocks(doc)
entries.content: Get all source blocks. #+BEGIN_SRC typescript const blocks = org.getSrcBlocks(doc); blocks.forEach(b => console.log(b.properties.language)); #+END_SRC

entries.heading: org.getTables(doc)
entries.content: Get all tables. #+BEGIN_SRC typescript const tables = org.getTables(doc); #+END_SRC

entries.heading: org.query(doc, criteria)
entries.content: Find elements matching multiple criteria at once.

entries.heading: Query Criteria
entries.content: | Property       | Type                 | Description                          | |----------------+----------------------+--------------------------------------| | type           | ElementType          | Element type to match                | | todoKeyword    | string or string[]   | Specific TODO keyword(s)             | | hasTodo        | boolean              | Has any TODO keyword                 | | todoType       | 'todo' or 'done'     | TODO type category                   | | tags

entries.heading: Examples
entries.content: #+BEGIN_SRC typescript // Find all TODO headlines with :project: tag const projects = org.query(doc, { type: 'headline', hasTodo: true, tags: ['project'] }); // Find headlines at level 2 or 3 const sections = org.query(doc, { type: 'headline', minLevel: 2, maxLevel: 3 }); // Find Python source blocks const pythonBlocks = org.query(doc, { type: 'src-block', language: 'python' }); // Find headlines with CATEGORY property set to 'work' const work = org.query(doc, { type: 'headline', property: { key

entries.heading: org.tableToJSON(table, options?)
entries.content: Convert an org table to JSON.

entries.heading: Options
entries.content: | Option       | Default | Description                       | |--------------+---------+-----------------------------------| | useHeader    | true    | Use first row as object keys      | | trim         | true    | Trim whitespace from cells        | | includeRules | false   | Include horizontal rule rows      | #+BEGIN_SRC typescript const tables = org.getTables(doc); const data = org.tableToJSON(tables[0]); // Returns: [{ name: 'Alice', age: '30' }, { name: 'Bob', age: '25' }] #+END_SRC

entries.heading: org.jsonToTable(data, options?)
entries.content: Convert JSON data to org table text. #+BEGIN_SRC typescript const table = org.jsonToTable([ { name: 'Alice', age: 30 }, { name: 'Bob', age: 25 } ]); // Returns: // | name  | age | // |-------+-----| // | Alice | 30  | // | Bob   | 25  | #+END_SRC

entries.heading: org.tableToCSV(table, options?)
entries.content: Convert an org table to CSV format.

entries.heading: Options
entries.content: | Option     | Default | Description                      | |------------+---------+----------------------------------| | useHeader  | true    | Include header row in output     | | trim       | true    | Trim whitespace from cells       | | delimiter  | ','     | Field separator character        | | quote      | '"'     | Quote character for escaping     | | lineEnding | '\n'    | Line ending character(s)         | #+BEGIN_SRC typescript const tables = org.getTables(doc); const csv = org.tableT

entries.heading: org.writeTableToCSV(filePath, table, options?)
entries.content: Write a table directly to a CSV file. #+BEGIN_SRC typescript const tables = org.getTables(doc); org.writeTableToCSV('./data.csv', tables[0]); // With semicolon delimiter org.writeTableToCSV('./data.csv', tables[0], { delimiter: ';' }); #+END_SRC

entries.heading: org.setTodo(headline, keyword, doneKeywords?)
entries.content: Set or remove TODO keyword. #+BEGIN_SRC typescript org.setTodo(headline, 'TODO');     // Set to TODO org.setTodo(headline, 'DONE');     // Set to DONE org.setTodo(headline, undefined);  // Remove TODO #+END_SRC

entries.heading: org.addTag(headline, tag)
entries.content: Add a tag to a headline. #+BEGIN_SRC typescript org.addTag(headline, 'important'); #+END_SRC

entries.heading: org.removeTag(headline, tag)
entries.content: Remove a tag from a headline. #+BEGIN_SRC typescript org.removeTag(headline, 'obsolete'); #+END_SRC

entries.heading: org.setProperty(headline, key, value)
entries.content: Set a property on a headline. #+BEGIN_SRC typescript org.setProperty(headline, 'CUSTOM_ID', 'my-section'); #+END_SRC

entries.heading: org.removeProperty(headline, key)
entries.content: Remove a property from a headline. #+BEGIN_SRC typescript org.removeProperty(headline, 'OLD_ID'); #+END_SRC

entries.heading: org.setPriority(headline, priority)
entries.content: Set or remove priority. #+BEGIN_SRC typescript org.setPriority(headline, 'A');     // Set priority org.setPriority(headline, undefined); // Remove priority #+END_SRC

entries.heading: org.sortHeadlines(headlines, compareFn)
entries.content: Sort headlines in place. #+BEGIN_SRC typescript // Sort by priority org.sortHeadlines(doc.children, (a, b) => { const priority = { A: 0, B: 1, C: 2 }; return (priority[a.properties.priority] || 99) - (priority[b.properties.priority] || 99); }); // Sort alphabetically org.sortHeadlines(doc.children, (a, b) => a.properties.rawValue.localeCompare(b.properties.rawValue) ); #+END_SRC

entries.heading: org.promoteHeadline(headline, recursive?)
entries.content: Decrease headline level (promote). #+BEGIN_SRC typescript org.promoteHeadline(headline);        // Promote with children org.promoteHeadline(headline, false); // Promote only this headline #+END_SRC

entries.heading: org.demoteHeadline(headline, recursive?)
entries.content: Increase headline level (demote). #+BEGIN_SRC typescript org.demoteHeadline(headline); #+END_SRC

entries.heading: org.createHeadline(title, level?, options?)
entries.content: Create a new headline element. #+BEGIN_SRC typescript // Basic headline const h = org.createHeadline('New Section', 2); // With TODO, priority, and tags const task = org.createHeadline('Important Task', 1, { todoKeyword: 'TODO', todoType: 'todo', priority: 'A', tags: ['urgent', 'work'], properties: { CUSTOM_ID: 'my-task' } }); #+END_SRC

entries.heading: org.insertHeadline(parent, headline, index?)
entries.content: Insert a headline into a document or parent headline. #+BEGIN_SRC typescript const newHeadline = org.createHeadline('New Section', 1); // Insert at end org.insertHeadline(doc, newHeadline); // Insert at specific position org.insertHeadline(doc, newHeadline, 0); // At beginning // Insert as child (level auto-adjusts) org.insertHeadline(parentHeadline, newHeadline); #+END_SRC

entries.heading: org.deleteHeadline(parent, headline)
entries.content: Delete a headline from its parent. #+BEGIN_SRC typescript // Delete by reference const deleted = org.deleteHeadline(doc, doc.children[0]); // Delete by index const deleted = org.deleteHeadline(doc, 2); #+END_SRC

entries.heading: org.copyHeadline(headline)
entries.content: Create a deep copy of a headline and its children. #+BEGIN_SRC typescript const original = doc.children[0]; const copy = org.copyHeadline(original); // Modify copy without affecting original copy.properties.rawValue = 'Modified Title'; org.insertHeadline(doc, copy); #+END_SRC

entries.heading: org.findParent(doc, headline)
entries.content: Find the parent of a headline (document or headline). #+BEGIN_SRC typescript const parent = org.findParent(doc, headline); if (parent.type === 'org-data') { console.log('Top-level headline'); } else { console.log('Child of:', parent.properties.rawValue); } #+END_SRC

entries.heading: org.getHeadlinePath(doc, headline)
entries.content: Get the path from root to a headline. #+BEGIN_SRC typescript const path = org.getHeadlinePath(doc, deepHeadline); // Returns: [Level1Headline, Level2Headline, targetHeadline] console.log(path.map(h => h.properties.rawValue).join(' > ')); #+END_SRC

entries.heading: org.createTimestamp(options)
entries.content: Create a timestamp object. #+BEGIN_SRC typescript // Basic date const ts = org.createTimestamp({ year: 2024, month: 3, day: 15 }); // <2024-03-15> // With time const ts = org.createTimestamp({ year: 2024, month: 3, day: 15, hour: 14, minute: 30 }); // <2024-03-15 14:30> // Inactive timestamp const ts = org.createTimestamp({ year: 2024, month: 3, day: 15, active: false }); // [2024-03-15] // With repeater const ts = org.createTimestamp({ year: 2024, month: 3, day: 15, repeaterType: '+', repeaterV

entries.heading: org.timestampFromDate(date, options?)
entries.content: Create a timestamp from a JavaScript Date. #+BEGIN_SRC typescript const ts = org.timestampFromDate(new Date()); const tsWithTime = org.timestampFromDate(new Date(), { includeTime: true }); #+END_SRC

entries.heading: org.timestampToDate(timestamp)
entries.content: Convert a timestamp to a JavaScript Date. #+BEGIN_SRC typescript const date = org.timestampToDate(headline.planning.scheduled); console.log(date.toLocaleDateString()); #+END_SRC

entries.heading: org.setScheduled(headline, timestamp)
entries.content: Set the SCHEDULED timestamp on a headline. #+BEGIN_SRC typescript const tomorrow = new Date(); tomorrow.setDate(tomorrow.getDate() + 1); org.setScheduled(headline, org.timestampFromDate(tomorrow)); // Remove scheduled org.setScheduled(headline, undefined); #+END_SRC

entries.heading: org.setDeadline(headline, timestamp)
entries.content: Set the DEADLINE timestamp on a headline. #+BEGIN_SRC typescript const nextWeek = new Date(); nextWeek.setDate(nextWeek.getDate() + 7); org.setDeadline(headline, org.timestampFromDate(nextWeek)); #+END_SRC

entries.heading: org.setClosed(headline, timestamp)
entries.content: Set the CLOSED timestamp on a headline. #+BEGIN_SRC typescript org.setTodo(headline, 'DONE'); org.setClosed(headline, org.timestampFromDate(new Date(), { active: false })); #+END_SRC

entries.heading: org.getScheduled / org.getDeadline / org.getClosed
entries.content: Get planning timestamps from a headline. #+BEGIN_SRC typescript const scheduled = org.getScheduled(headline); const deadline = org.getDeadline(headline); const closed = org.getClosed(headline); if (deadline) { const daysUntil = Math.ceil( (org.timestampToDate(deadline) - new Date()) / (1000 * 60 * 60 * 24) ); console.log(`Due in ${daysUntil} days`); } #+END_SRC

entries.heading: org.getLinks(doc)
entries.content: Get all links in a document. #+BEGIN_SRC typescript const links = org.getLinks(doc); links.forEach(link => { console.log(`${link.properties.linkType}: ${link.properties.path}`); }); #+END_SRC

entries.heading: org.getLinksByType(doc, linkType)
entries.content: Get links filtered by type. #+BEGIN_SRC typescript const webLinks = org.getLinksByType(doc, 'https'); const fileLinks = org.getLinksByType(doc, 'file'); #+END_SRC

entries.heading: org.createLink(path, description?, linkType?)
entries.content: Create a link object. #+BEGIN_SRC typescript const link = org.createLink('https://example.com', 'Example Site'); const fileLink = org.createLink('file:notes.org', 'My Notes'); #+END_SRC

entries.heading: org.getClockEntries(headline)
entries.content: Get all clock entries from a headline. #+BEGIN_SRC typescript const clocks = org.getClockEntries(headline); clocks.forEach(clock => { console.log(`Duration: ${clock.properties.duration}`); }); #+END_SRC

entries.heading: org.getAllClockEntries(doc)
entries.content: Get all clock entries from a document with their parent headlines. #+BEGIN_SRC typescript const entries = org.getAllClockEntries(doc); entries.forEach(({ clock, headline }) => { console.log(`${headline.properties.rawValue}: ${clock.properties.duration}`); }); #+END_SRC

entries.heading: org.getTotalClockTime(headline, recursive?)
entries.content: Calculate total clocked time in minutes. #+BEGIN_SRC typescript const minutes = org.getTotalClockTime(headline); console.log(`Time spent: ${org.formatDuration(minutes)}`); // Include children const totalWithChildren = org.getTotalClockTime(headline, true); #+END_SRC

entries.heading: org.formatDuration(minutes)
entries.content: Format minutes as HH:MM string. #+BEGIN_SRC typescript org.formatDuration(90);  // "1:30" org.formatDuration(125); // "2:05" #+END_SRC

entries.heading: org.getInheritedProperty(doc, headline, key)
entries.content: Get a property value, checking ancestors if not set on headline. #+BEGIN_SRC typescript // Will check headline, then parents, then document const category = org.getInheritedProperty(doc, headline, 'CATEGORY'); #+END_SRC

entries.heading: org.getEffectiveProperties(doc, headline)
entries.content: Get all properties including inherited ones. #+BEGIN_SRC typescript const props = org.getEffectiveProperties(doc, headline); console.log(props['CATEGORY']); // From nearest ancestor console.log(props['CUSTOM_ID']); // From headline itself #+END_SRC

entries.heading: Archive All DONE Items
entries.content: #+BEGIN_SRC typescript :results silent import { org } from 'scimax'; const doc = org.parseFile('./tasks.org'); org.mapHeadlines(doc, h => { if (h.properties.todoType === 'done') { org.addTag(h, 'ARCHIVE'); } }); org.writeFile('./tasks.org', doc); #+END_SRC

entries.heading: Generate Project Summary
entries.content: #+BEGIN_SRC typescript :results output import { org } from 'scimax'; const doc = org.parseFile('./projects.org'); const projects = org.query(doc, { tags: ['project'] }); console.log('# Project Summary\n'); for (const project of projects) { const status = project.properties.todoKeyword || 'No status'; const priority = project.properties.priority || '-'; console.log(`- [${priority}] ${project.properties.rawValue} (${status})`); } #+END_SRC

entries.heading: Extract Table Data Across Files
entries.content: #+BEGIN_SRC typescript :results value import { org } from 'scimax'; import * as fs from 'fs'; const files = fs.readdirSync('.').filter(f => f.endsWith('.org')); const allData = []; for (const file of files) { const doc = org.parseFile(file); const tables = org.getTables(doc); for (const table of tables) { const data = org.tableToJSON(table); allData.push(...data); } } return allData; #+END_SRC

entries.heading: Export Tables to CSV Files
entries.content: #+BEGIN_SRC typescript :results output import { org } from 'scimax'; const doc = org.parseFile('./data.org'); const tables = org.getTables(doc); // Export first table to CSV org.writeTableToCSV('./output/table1.csv', tables[0]); console.log('Exported table1.csv'); // Export all tables with custom options tables.forEach((table, i) => { org.writeTableToCSV(`./output/table${i + 1}.csv`, table, { delimiter: ';',      // Semicolon for Excel compatibility lineEnding: '\r\n'   // Windows line endings }

entries.heading: Export Named Table
entries.content: #+BEGIN_SRC typescript :results output import { org } from 'scimax'; import * as fs from 'fs'; const doc = org.parseFile('./report.org'); // Find a table by the headline containing it const dataSection = org.findHeadline(doc, h => h.properties.rawValue === 'Results Data' ); if (dataSection?.section) { const table = dataSection.section.children.find( el => el.type === 'table' ); if (table) { const csv = org.tableToCSV(table); fs.writeFileSync('./results.csv', csv); console.log('Exported results.c

entries.heading: Bulk Update Properties
entries.content: #+BEGIN_SRC typescript :results silent import { org } from 'scimax'; const doc = org.parseFile('./notes.org'); org.mapHeadlines(doc, h => { // Add CREATED property if missing if (!h.propertiesDrawer?.['CREATED']) { org.setProperty(h, 'CREATED', new Date().toISOString().split('T')[0]); } // Set CATEGORY based on tags if (h.properties.tags.includes('work')) { org.setProperty(h, 'CATEGORY', 'Work'); } else if (h.properties.tags.includes('personal')) { org.setProperty(h, 'CATEGORY', 'Personal');

entries.heading: Reorganize by Priority
entries.content: #+BEGIN_SRC typescript :results silent import { org } from 'scimax'; const doc = org.parseFile('./tasks.org'); // Sort top-level headlines by priority org.sortHeadlines(doc.children, (a, b) => { const priorityOrder = { A: 0, B: 1, C: 2 }; const aPriority = priorityOrder[a.properties.priority] ?? 99; const bPriority = priorityOrder[b.properties.priority] ?? 99; return aPriority - bPriority; }); org.writeFile('./tasks.org', doc); #+END_SRC

entries.heading: Schedule All Unscheduled TODOs
entries.content: #+BEGIN_SRC typescript :results silent import { org } from 'scimax'; const doc = org.parseFile('./tasks.org'); // Find unscheduled TODOs const unscheduled = org.query(doc, { hasTodo: true, todoType: 'todo' }).filter(h => !org.getScheduled(h) && !org.getDeadline(h)); // Schedule them for tomorrow const tomorrow = new Date(); tomorrow.setDate(tomorrow.getDate() + 1); const ts = org.timestampFromDate(tomorrow); unscheduled.forEach(h => org.setScheduled(h, ts)); org.writeFile('./tasks.org', doc); co

entries.heading: Generate Time Report
entries.content: #+BEGIN_SRC typescript :results output import { org } from 'scimax'; const doc = org.parseFile('./work.org'); console.log('# Time Report\n'); org.mapHeadlines(doc, h => { const time = org.getTotalClockTime(h, true); if (time > 0) { const indent = '  '.repeat(h.properties.level - 1); console.log(`${indent}- ${h.properties.rawValue}: ${org.formatDuration(time)}`); } }); #+END_SRC

entries.heading: Clone Template Headline
entries.content: #+BEGIN_SRC typescript :results silent import { org } from 'scimax'; const doc = org.parseFile('./projects.org'); // Find template headline const template = org.findHeadline(doc, h => h.properties.tags.includes('template') ); if (template) { // Create new project from template const newProject = org.copyHeadline(template); newProject.properties.rawValue = 'New Project'; org.removeTag(newProject, 'template'); org.setTodo(newProject, 'TODO'); org.setProperty(newProject, 'CREATED', new Date().toISO

entries.heading: Move Completed Tasks to Archive
entries.content: #+BEGIN_SRC typescript :results silent import { org } from 'scimax'; const doc = org.parseFile('./tasks.org'); // Find or create archive headline let archive = org.findHeadline(doc, h => h.properties.rawValue === 'Archive' ); if (!archive) { archive = org.createHeadline('Archive', 1); org.insertHeadline(doc, archive); } // Find and move done items const done = org.query(doc, { todoType: 'done' }) .filter(h => !h.properties.tags.includes('ARCHIVE')); done.forEach(h => { const parent = org.findPar

entries.heading: Headline Element Structure
entries.content: When working with headlines, you have access to these properties: #+BEGIN_SRC typescript interface HeadlineElement { type: 'headline'; properties: { level: number;           // 1-based heading level rawValue: string;        // Title text todoKeyword?: string;    // 'TODO', 'DONE', etc. todoType?: 'todo' | 'done'; priority?: string;       // 'A', 'B', 'C' tags: string[];          // Tag list archivedp: boolean;      // Has :ARCHIVE: tag commentedp: boolean;     // Has COMMENT prefix
